text: Best crepes in the city. I also really like their blood orange old fashioned cocktail, served with a large ball of ice. All the other food I've had has been really good, too. I highly recommend this place for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and drinks. They do it all! My favorite local place.
Great food. Service was fast and appetizer were amazing! Really cool atmosphere too. Come back for sure!

Euro Cafe-- Great atmosphere, open late(!!). All kinds of crepes and various Espresso/Coffee drinks! Many other cafe and dinner options-- Haven't had a bad menu item. Perfect date spot. (Just hoping too many people don't find out about it!! It'll be our secret, ok?) ps. They actually have an iguana
This place has a good vibe but we were not impressed by the food or the service. We ordered a wrap to split and it was basically just a mayonnaise wrap. I would not recommend eating here.
The best place for crepes. I've had their sandwiches and savory items before they're not as good as their crepes but they're still very delicious. Their staff is really friendly and accommodating.
This is me and my boyfriend's favorite late night spot. They're mimosas are divine!!!!!!!

Excellent European style cafe in the West Loop. The restaurant has a very relaxed and modern artistic ambience, and was not too busy around lunch time on a Sunday. The food came fairly quickly, perhaps about ten minutes. The crepes - highly recommend! They are very fresh and they have such a wide selection. The  creamy caramel creations was such a treat, you must try it if you like caramel. The Venice was also very fresh and had a distinct taste of red peppers. The Napolitan was an excellent carbonara dish, and is a good dish for sharing. They also had a special of an egg soufflé which was delicious, as there was potato on the bottom and seemed quite gourmet. Overall, very high quality food and would recommend!

Pleasantly surprised! On the walk to this location, I was a little nervous about how the quality of the food would be- but all in all great experience. We ordered a couple glasses of champagne and the goat cheese, sun-dried tomato pasta. It was very good, but very cheesy! Definitely enough for 2 people. I wanted to come here specifically for the crepes and they did not disappoint. We had the banana foster with a side of Nutella. Perfectly caramelized bananas and the crepe was perfectly made and folded. More than enough for 2 people!

Love this place! The food and service were very good here. My friends and I ordered the tropical pleasure waffle, the classic tempting trio crepe, and the spicy chicken wrap. They were all pretty good.  It's a good place to have brunch, lunch and some cocktails. The atmosphere was also great, and prices were reasonable. Definitely try the Iguana Café once.

Love this place! Hidden gem for sure. Delicious salads and crepes. Next time I want to try a sandwich. The coffee is incredible. The iced mocha latte is life changing, trust me. Wifi is reliable too and the waitstaff doesn't hover but are always nearby if you need something. Very friendly, relaxed neighborhood vibe. It honestly doesn't feel like you're in Chicago, it feels like a European cafe (which it is). I've gone about three times in the past week and I honestly can't get enough! Highly recommend for a weekend brunch or late afternoon boost.

I really like this place for some reason. The food isn't outstanding and the service is hit or miss but I like the vibe and it's a good value. Prices are very reasonable, they have an extensive bar, and a variety of menu items. Certainly many crepe options as well. If you're looking for something solid and good value for your money, and maybe some cocktails, this would be a great bet.
We have been frequenting iguana for a few years now. Quality food, reasonably price and friendly staff.

Ordered the Spicy Chicken Wrap.  It was pretty good, but the ingredients did not taste very fresh.  From what I've seen in the pictures, it looks like maybe I should have ordered something else.  Otherwise the atmosphere and the wait staff were all great.  Service was friendly and I enjoyed hanging out there while eating my lunch.

Absolutely love coming to this place with my friends when we meet for brunch.  It's very authentic and reminds me of many European cafes.  Prices are reasonable and there are many options on the menu.  Their sandwiches and wraps are delicious.  I'm a huge fan of feta cheese and it's incorporated into many of their dishes.  Also there is a wide variety of crepes to choose from.  My personal preference is nutella and maybe some strawberry or banana.
SO GOOD! Fastest delivery I've ever gotten and the food is amazing! Will definitely be a new go to spot for me

Love the ambience of this place. The music always takes me back to my time living in London. And I love the fact that whenever I think I want something sweet or savory late at night they're usually open to accommodate me. I've never had a problem finding street parking. Service has never been much to write home about but it's not horrible either.

A great place for coffee and brunch! This cafe is reminescent of coffee houses in Europe, very dimly lit with interesting decor. I ordered the raspberry mocha to start. I's absolutely delicious! There is a light fruity taste that isn't overpowering. Then we shared the carbonara pasta in clay pot. WOW this is amazing! The cheese is soooo melty and the pasta is super savory with the perfect amount of bacon bites. We devoured it within minutes! We also shared a savory crepe- we got the Lyon crepe. Since we just finished the carbonara pasta, we weren't feeling the cheese in the Lyon crepe very much. I'm sure if we had eaten the savory crepe before the pasta, it would've been a different story!  The prices are very affordable. Service is great!

Was here for a meet up with a colleague just for coffee.  Nice quiet and quaint café in the west loop.  Easy to get to and really enjoyed the space and the coffee.  Looking forward to retiring soon and enjoying a bite to eat.

I've been here about 4 times (at around 8 p.m) and there's always a good size crowd, but not to the point where you have to be wait to be seated. There's a very "European" feel to this place, the decor is modern, and the ambiance is pretty casual. The pesto chicken pasta is my favorite dish- it's is soooo good. It's baked in clay bowl & the cheese is perfectly melted on top.

A cute and affordable European cafe open late! There is plenty of seating and good for bigger groups as well (try to make reservation) I love the ability to create your own crepes (sweet or savory) but I stick to my usual nutella, strawberry and banana! The pasta dishes are great portions and are a fair price, especially cheesy! The tomato basil soup is a perfect pick me up on a cold day. The frappe is authentic (Greek) and perfect to compliment your crepes. The sandwiches are also tasty. A big draw for me is the big menu and almost everything is customizable. The service is usually excellent and the servers are friendly. A cute spot for a quick bite to eat or a few hours catching up on homework/work or with friends!

I met some friends from grade school for brunch at Iguana Cafe yesterday afternoon and we had a great experience! Each of us ordered one of their breakfast or dessert crepes & we all enjoyed our meals.  I had the Coliseum breakfast crepe, which comes with eggs, spinach, provolone cheese, and tomatoes in a wheat crepe.  It had great flavor without being greasy and came with a small salad of mixed greens with vinaigrette on the side.  My friends got the Pantheon crepe and the Tempting Trio crepe and they enjoyed theirs as well!   In reading other Yelpers' reviews prior to coming here, I would definitely agree that this restaurant/coffee shop has a European feel.  The staff was friendly and accommodating, giving us time to enjoy our meals and each other's company.  We never felt rushed and, as a result, spent more time than we typically do catching up when we meet up to go out to eat.  I think the quaint and relaxed vibe of this joint is reason alone to stop by!   I would definitely recommend Iguana Cafe for a weekend brunch or lunch with friends.  They have a wide variety of fare on their menu, their drink menu provides something for everyone, and they take reservations.  I hope to be back with friends sometime soon!

One of my fav cafes for coffee and/or food! Iguana cafe is located in river west area of downtown chicago and definitely offers a "taste of Europe" as they claim. I've tried their raspberry mocha, Nutella crepe, and jalapeño cheese dip and all items have been delicious and leaving me wanting more. All items are reasonably priced which is a plus. I'm looking forward to coming back and trying more on the menu as the pasta dishes sound phenomenal!  It does get quite busy during lunch hours, however, if you come in the morning or after lunch- there's tons of spots and availability. Lots of outlets as well and the wifi works great. I know some of the reviews say it's more of a sit down restaurant - which I agree, but the laid back vibe makes it a cool spot to get work done at as well. Another big plus is the hours!!! They are open 7 am - 12 am which is unlike most coffee shops and they have a full bar so it definitely offers the best of both worlds.

Excellent service. Everyone was very mannered, kind, and did their job! :) Pastas are always so good every time I come here! My best pasta in Chicago is Pinstripe's (compared "price" and location among other similar restaurants), but Iguana has Pinstripe's taste but with better price and larger food portion. Bread was warm and soft. Waffles were good. Crepes were good. If you can't decide what to order now, order any pasta and you will like it. :)

Seems like a nice cafe but it's not a good spot for getting a coffee and getting some work done with your laptop. It's more of a sit down restaurant. I have no reason to mark it down for that though, I'm just removing a star because the speakers are very bad quality so the music they play sounds like a lot of clicks and it is a little annoying.  The wifi is also quite slow, but again, it's not a good cafe for working. The coffee was dank though!

Great food friendly people but more than anything I love the atmosphere. This is my  fourth time here in the last couple weeks and i becoming a regular. Must try a chocolate delight crepe, and the blood orange infused old fashion. The pastas are pretty good also.

Crepe themselves were ok, but clearly made hours ago, the ingredients were all frozen/reheated with no taste except the Parma Ham which was very salty and more ham you would buy in Walmart. The drinks were generous on the alcohol
I'm not sure how this place has 4 stars. The waitresses were not very helpful or attentive. Barely spoke English in fact. The food was lousy and lazy put together.
The European dream waffles are amazing! Cute place, open late & good price. Would def recommend.

Nice place we have been going to for years now. When in area or craving the chicken pesto pasta we stop in. You can usually find meter parking around block if not in front. Service varies, sometimes great other times ehhh. My friends love their crepes as well.

I love this place! Open late and you can go for dessert, drinks coffee or a full meal. Great vibe and it's perfect place to have nice conversation with friends or fam:) Parking is often a little tricky, but I usually find street parking.

Hands down the BEST chicken pesto pasta I've tried in Chicago. The portions are massive so I would definitely reccomend getting one bowl if two people want the same kind of pasta. We usually have the cheese dip as an appetizer which comes with warm crunchy or pita bread. The staff is friendly and there's always room to sit, even Friday evenings! It's never a disappointment.

This was my first time visiting Iguana Cafe. In the issue of time, I wont go into too many details, but here are the three main reasons I only gave this restaurant two stars: 1) Our visit was on a Sunday, I called on the previous wednesday to make the reservation for 10 people- the man on the phone took my reservation and confirmed it. Unfortunately, once we arrived, we had to wait over 30 minutes for our table because they said we didnt have a reservation. Ok fine. These mistakes happen (even though I had record of the call on my phone log). But the issue was their "hostess" was anything but apologetic, in fact, she gave me attitude about it.  2) The food was just so-so;  nothing more than what you'd find at a corner diner. 3) Another disappointment was that the waitress did not tell me that the tip was already added in. We ended up only having 7 people so I didnt think that she would add it in, and obviously my fault for not checking. But I waited tables for 7 years and I would always let customers know when I added in the tip for a larger table. I guess some people are honest, while others are not. For these reasons, I will not be back.

Such a cozy cafe! Our server was super attentive and prompt with our order. They have an extensive drink list and the coffee was excellent. I loved the ambience of the place. My wrap was a little mushy, however, the pasta and crepes looked delish! I also love that they are open late in case people want to hang out or study. Definitely recommend:)

Amazing food and amazing prices. We came in on a Saturday afternoon looking for a tasty and filling lunch and definitely found it here. This cafe is a mix between a coffee shop and full service restaurant. You have to wait to be seated and you get service the whole time but there's a little grab and go coffee counter as well. We ordered a beer and a frozen margarita as well as the bruschetta. It came out only minutes later piled high with tomatoes, cheese and prosciutto. Very filling and tasty. The menu is extensive with many options both healthy and indulgent. I ordered the smoked salmon salad and it was a big portion and served with small toast slices. My fiancé got a crepe and added prosciutto to it as well and it was huge--we weren't able to finish our meals. The check came to a very very reasonable $41 for two people... Including two alcoholic drinks, an appetizer and two entrees. Service was great and our water glasses were always full. Glad to have this spot in the neighborhood.
We find waitress in this cafe who named Nadya. She is so good. I recommend their coffee latte. Also, banana crape with ice cream.

I love iguana cafe!!! Every Saturday night I come here i find only the most professional and the most beautiful waitress I've ever seen( don't remember her name). U should try Nutella banana crape and browny alamode
Great please to visit Went there on Saturday night with my friends. We had the best food and service. I definitely will be back

We went here on a Wednesday night to try to unwind from the day with some dessert. We had the Bananas Foster crepe and the Tempting Trio crepe. Both were absolutely delicious, and had good portion sizes as well. We will be back to try some of their delicious looking food off the main menu. Thank you for a nice end to our night!
Love this place! Great coffee and desserts. Customer service is excellent. A fun casual spot to hangout with friends.
Such a cute place. Absolute love. I wanted to order the whole menu. Definitely will be coming back.
This is my favorite place to grab a sandwich and soup in Chicago! The atmosphere is cozy and the staff has always been super friendly. This is a hidden gem in Chicago!

Absolutely horrible service. We came in on January 1 at around 1:30 with a group of 4. The place was not busy, only a few tables. We sat down and I asked for a coffee right away. I was told by the waitress that she'll be right back. 20 minutes later I asked for a coffee again which took another 10-15 minutes to get, cold. Our food came our quickly, but it was also cold. We sent some of the dishes back to warm up. Eating cold crepes with cold sausage was not how we wanted to eat our first meal of the year. Finally, the server came back and asked if we needed anything else. We didn't. 20 minutes later still no check as we sit at an empty table. We had to get up and get the check from a guy behind the counter. Terrible experience.
horrible service. The blonde lady with the accent was very rude in her tone. She gave very sharp responses and never introduced herself, came back to check on us, or smiled.

This place never seizes to delight me with their European Dream (Belgian waffle with a diabetics nightmare drizzled all over).  I've been here a few times with friends, and we can all agree that their dessert menu is a force to be reckoned with. As for their service, the server that brings the water out is very pleasant, but the one who takes our order is a bit rude.  She is so impatient with taking our oder. The specific experience I'm referring to is when I came with a friend once and ordered promptly.  The server came out with our dishes, and I very politely and gently said "oh wait this is actually his dish" as she placed the wrong plate in front of me.  The moment I said that, her eyes opened up wide as if I had delivered some horrible news to her.  She stared at me for a good 5 seconds, and then switched the dishes and walked away quickly.  A few moments later, I requested for her and said that they had made a mistake.  I nicely explained that I had asked for extra nutella on my waffle and not my friend because they stuffed his crepes with an excessive amount.  She apologized and came back out with a whole jar of Nutella.  I was baffled as to why she had done that.  I told her that was way too much, and her remark though rude made me giggle "don't worry you can take that home with you, I'll pack it."   All in all, that was a very odd experience, but I do highly recommend this place.  I hope that lady really sees this review and gets a laugh out of it but also treats us more properly next time.

Want to break your diet with style? Come here!  They have healthy options but also great cheat food options. We were by the area, saw the reviews, and decided to stop by. We had some iced-coffee with us, they don't allow outside drinks but let us keep ours as long as we emptied them in one of their glasses.  Napolitan and Carbonara pasta were both creamy cheesy deliciousness goodness. Tasted a lot like Mac and Cheese but with spaghetti. Worth a try, especially the Napolitan! Bougasta with Nutella was amazing! There were three and we practically fought over the third. It was soft in the centre and covered in phyllo dough topped with syrup and Nutella.  The service was very friendly and service was quick, prices are also amazing for the quality and amount of food that you get. You will leave full and satisfied with no regrets!
Pretty good crepes but nothing to write home about. The staff was kinda pushy and I kinda wanted to eat in peace. Had to go to meet friends, but I wouldn't go on my own volition.

This hip spot is a great place to hang with friends. All the dishes are clean and nicely plated. My sandwich was delicious and my drink very good. I recommend this restaurant if you are in river north and need to blow some time.

A cute little cafe on north Halsted! We went for a friend's dinner party there with a party of 10 and they were more than accommodating. The staff was friendly and the decor was cute but a little hard to see as the lighting was dim. A bonus point is that they're open late! We had the baked goat cheese for appetizers, which was a bit dry and bland with a hint of tomato basil sauce. I ordered the spinach pesto pasta which was really good, but the highlight of the whole night was the dessert waffle! We ordered a European Dream and Sweet Addiction; both were heavenly and shareable. I'd definitely order this, even if you're just getting coffee. All in all, a nice place if you're looking to chill with some friends or a date and share a waffle or two :)

Cool place. Had the Chicken pesto sandwich... as others noted, I was not disappointed. The place got busier as I ate. Definitely attracted an international crowd. Pretty cool atmosphere. I'll be more adventurous next time as there were plenty of items on the menu I want to try!
One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago.  Beautiful ambiance, delicious food, the perfect place to dress up or down.

was there yesterday... They need to CLEAN the bathrooms,  wash the Windows and dust... didn't see the kitchen but that must be a mess as well... the food was good til I felt like tossing it when I went to the bathroom
It's overpriced and dark inside. I do remember coming here once late and having a lot of crepes and that was fun. I guess it's good for sweet stuff. The filter coffee was super watery.

The Good This is one of our favorite post-dinner spots for my husband and I.  Open late-night which is nice when you are looking for a place to go after 10PM (and when most other places are closed) The Better Prices are reasonable especially for entrees - their Tuna Sandwich on french bread is always so good and filling.  Crepes are big enough to be shared, and coffee is always good. The Best Hands down the Chocolate Monkey, Chocolatey Delight and Nutella Peanut Butter Cup are always great choices if you are big on chocolate crepes.  My personal favorite is the Nutella Peanut Butter Cup crepe with a scoop of their chocolate ice cream.  It will not disappoint!
I would recommend 11/10, best pasta I have ever had in mahhhhh life. Everyone should definitely come here more often, I know I will be!!!!!! Dis is my new favorite place to go to
It was my first time visited this place and I like it. If you wanna try something new and delicious you should visiting this place )

Solid brunch place with an extensive menu. Conveniently located next to the blue line as well so a good place to meet friends coming from different parts of the city. I liked the ambience a lot. It was really open and has cute decor. You don't feel like you're screaming at your friends to chat with them because another table is two inches away. I ordered a breakfast crepe and it was tasty. I'd be down to return and try something else on the menu.

The nicest staff in Chicago. Genuinely kind and welcoming. The waiter even ran my jacket out to me when I forgot it. Excellent martini, and the two times I've eaten here, it's been very good. Fresh and delicious food.

One of the best hidden gems in Chicago!  From wraps to crepes to dessert waffles to coffee - you can't go wrong here, everything is fantastic!  Also, very affordable - I highly recommend if you're in the area.

Friendly staff ! Super fast service . Cool interior. Only thing I wasn't crazy about were the eggs in my sandwich which tasted pre made, also the bagel was eh. But ten again I'm from ny so I'm kinda a bagel snob

I was looking for a cheap quick place to get food.  The Iguana Cafe has a great atmosphere.  Dimmed light,  music in the background, very well decorated.  You can tell they spent a lot of time on the place.  Whether you are going on a date or getting work done on your  laptop.  This is the place to be.  Great selection of wine and deserts.  I ordered a sandwich wrap and it was amazing!  My friend ordered pasta who gave his meal 5 stars.  I will do the same. Definitely will be back

I love the food here and it never disappoint. There are 2 real iguanas inside the cafe which is pretty awesome. I usually order spinach & artichoke dip, smoked salmon sandwich or tropical pleasure waffle. The spinach & artichoke dip with is pita bread is sooo good. I love the smoked salmon sandwich, it light and smoky. The tropical pleasure is good, but it can be on the heavy side for some people. Overall, i love this place.

Normally the service is good but yesterday I stopped in for a bite with my girlfriend. Place was almost empty with a few people there, we're sitting waiting for someone to come by and take our order, two employee standing by the bar doing nothing.....not taking order, answering calls or talking to a customer, just standing there! The tall skinny blonde was the worst, seems to be annoyed that she had to take our order when it was close to her quitting time, 3pm? After she left, another waitress short blonde took over, now she's the person they need more of, she was very pleasant and nice. If it wasn't for her, we could probably left without tipping.

Thanks to Iguana and DoorDash, I had a savory chicken crepe and a decaf ice pumpkin spice latte delivered straight to my door at 9 PM on a Saturday night. Food was delicious. Drink was yummy. I was lazy and totally comfortable binge watching Preacher. Priorities. it's the little things in life, folks.  The food was a decent portion. I actually had some left over for breakfast and a mid-morning snack. The coffee was really delicious. Probably one of the best pumpkin spice lattes I have ever had. The delivery was on time and the driver was friendly. Hey, if I can get that meal delivered to my door, and it was tasty, I have no complaints. Give it a try.
Delicious and inexpensive food, good drinks, nice atmosphere. Loved the Strawberry Mojito. Service is not super friendly but it's prompt. One of the places I always come back to.
Super yummy and inexpensive croissant breakfast sandwiches. Great place to stop into on my way to work!

Was impressed came Sunday night around 11 was still open, service was quick,great atmosphere, amazing dessert menu. Will be coming back  Came in again still impressed consistent food quality and desserts were amazing had the banana split this time
Delicious!!! I built my own sandwich, and each of the ingredients was fresh and tasty. The Nutella crepe was sweet and delicious, and the drinks were strong but well-made. Service was also lovely.
It's a great place to go to for a late night coffee after dinner. They have decent dessert. Service is okay. Street parking but easy to find a spot right in front.

Staff was very nice and friendly. Food was definitely bland. No fresh eggs at all. It was just some weird spongy yellow square supposedly made of egg....? For a breakfast place I probably wouldn't go back.

Generally when I here the word café I think of a women's light lunch with dessert and coffee. This place does have dessert and coffee, along with a variety of light to medium eats, crepes, salads, wraps and sandwiches. In addition to the food, they serve alcohol, wine/beer and the harder stuff.  I had the Sparta, and it was perfect, in general I like any combination of spinach, feta and mushrooms. Add chicken and a crepe or eggs as an omelette and I'm a happy camper. Everything in this crepe was fresh and the chicken wasn't salty, which is a usual complaint of mine. I also didn't need to put any salt or pepper on it, as I said, perfect. I also enjoyed a a tasty white sangria, it was just the thing for a hot day, when the last thing you need is too much alcohol.  The vibe is bar like, dim with wood tables, not what I don't think about when you hear the word café. Perhaps, this is why there were more guys then women when I was here, this place had a different feel than Lutz or Selamarie for instance.  I wish I had stumbled upon this place sooner, but now that I have I definitely will be back.

This was a great bang for the buck. The service was great and this place is nothing over the top but it a consistent go to place. The dessert crepes looked great!  The chicken crepe had plenty of chicken and nice fresh vegetables. The atmosphere had a happening vibe. It was the perfect place to take a group to as the food was good and we waited on immediately. The orders came out quickly which provides for a quick can't miss lunch if you are on the go. Crepes were a fad at one point in time and it is nice to see its return.  Nice to have a sandwich without all of the bread. Crepes were prepared with a nice airy texture and had a distinct flavor. This is a place I will continue to stop at when I am in the area!!!

I stumbled upon this place when I had an intense craving for crepes. I guess I could say that I have a small obsession with them so I am always on the lookout for places that serve great crepes. I got the classic Tempting Trio crepe (Nutella, bananas, strawberries) and my friend got the Tropical Pleasure waffle. The portion sizes are huge here so you are sure to get your money's worth. The taste, however, was pretty mediocre. Normally, I am able to scarf down crepes larger than the size of my face (this one was as large as my face) with ease, but I found myself having a hard time finishing my crepe here. The ingredients were pretty run-of-the-mill and I found the presence of Nutella to be a bit overwhelming, especially towards the end. After finishing the crepe, I was left feeling a bit nauseated due to the overdose of sweetness I had just consumed. My friend felt the same after consuming his waffle (he even added ice cream to it...big mistake). If you have a huge sweet tooth, perhaps you should check out the Iguana Cafe. Otherwise, be prepared to experience an unpleasant overdose of sugar.

Best ice cream waffle thingies in the world!!! Lol. Server was also very friendly! This place has an amazing vibe and food to match. I came for desert and wound up eating a full dinner. Definitely a crowd pleaser. would recommend if you'd like to please picky guests in town like I did. Lol
Extremely tasty for breakfast! Has about every type of breakfast item you could possibly want, the varieties are endless!

When there is nothing to eat at home I love grabbing  a quick savory crepe. I've had both sweet and savory and it has been great every time. They have other deserts and sandwiches that are also wonderful. This is my sisters favorite place when she comes to visit me here in the city !

Okay place for morning drinks & breakfast. Service was pleasant.  Prices reasonable. Crepe was large for $6.95, was able to take half home. It included spinach, omelet cubes, cheese, and tomato.  At this price point, I feel it was a fair deal.  I wasn't expecting to be wow'd, just a straight forward, no surprises crepe, which it was.  Boyfriend had the ham & cheese wrap. Again for $5.50 not expecting to be amazed, it was a solid no thrills wrap and for that price felt it was more than adequate.
Nadia on Saturday nights is absolutely beautiful & her service was amazing! Not to mention the crepes were out of this world!

This place was awesome. Came late at night with family for dessert and they were still open and the service was speedy! The desserts were amazing. I had a crepe and we all tried an assortment of other things. The brownie a la mode was great! The atmosphere is very chill and the decor is really nice.

Good food okay service. Delicious gluten free chicken and pesto pasta. Hot and warm bread with fresh house made cheesy spinch and artichoke dip. Ok chicken wrap but not enough chicken. Fresh house made raspberry lemonade. Customer service 1 star. No one greeted us upon entering establishment, server did not introduce herself, ask if we had been there before, or offer any information about the restaurant or their menu, and  rushed us to take our order.

Wanted to really like it but was very disappointed by the smoothie and sandwich I purchased. The strawberry smoothie was icey and had no flavor - not worth $4. My Mediterranean sandwich was super soggy and feel apart. The bread was hard to bite in some parts while other parts where just plain mush. The side salad I got was just lettuce. I now feel bad paying $15 for a meal that I could have gotten better at subway - i would have saved $10 as well.

Dessert is good. The place is really not open until midnight.  We arrived at 11:15 and were basically hurried out and rushed to make an order.  They stop taking dine ins early but they need to specify.

What a great breakfast/lunch spot!   Met up with some friends on a Saturday morning.  Huge menu...tons of breakfast crepes.  Fantastic coffee.  My only compliant was our server never asked to refill our coffees.  We kept having to wave her over.  The Acropolis crepe was phenomenal!  It had a fluffy texture with a great fresh mix of veggie & cheese.  YUM!  Hummus plate was HUGE!  Ton o hummus with pita and veggies...yummy!!!! I would definitely go back here.

GREAT FOOD, beautiful setting. Jose served us and was wonderful! We later got our waitress Nadia who was nasty and RUDE. Don't know how to rate restaurant since Jose and the food were so wonderful and she was beyond awful.

The service at this cafe was excellent. We were greeted nicely and served quickly. Our food came out within minutes of the order, and they were all amazing! I especially enjoyed the taffy apple crepe and the tagosta. Both melted in your mouth, and the ice cream was a perfect compliment to them. Their espressos and drinks were great as well. Definitely a cool place to check out and spend some time with friends if you're in downtown Chicago in Fulton River District

This place showed up when I searched for a coffee shop, it's more of a restaurant that serves lattes. Since I'm traveling and phone was dying I decided to give it a try. Of the 5 servers working in a restaurant with 3 seated tables it took a good 10 minutes to even be noticed. Then every single one of them has been ... rude and unwelcoming. My first bad Chicago experience, but I won't hold it against the city.

Food and ambience is very nice. Everything is good except for the gentleman who receives us. He doesn't greet back and just makes me and my girlfriend feel like we are uninvited guests to his home. We actually came back few times for the food until just didn't feel good coming in and decided to stop.

This place is absolutely phenomenal. Their BLT sandwich is delicious and cheap. The wraps are all cooked panini style and more heavenly than any panini you've ever eaten.  Every time I come in here, I order something different and it's MY NEW FAVORITE MENU ITEM. It is literally all excellent food and CHEAP.  My favorite part about this place is the alcohol, however--the key lime martini will send you to Jamaica and back! Absolutely delicious and yet still stout enough to deliver a punch. Their glasses of wine range from $5.50 (yep you read that right) to full bottles with lots of selection at different price points.  The staff are kind, welcoming, and remember you as a person. I am always recognized here, despite the fact I only stop in once a week or so. I work on the far north side but still find an excuse to come here! EAT HERE!!! It's the BEST spot in the city I've found to date!!!!
If u don't want to wait in line for wildberry this cafe is the best place to come too! I usually come here after late night parties! Get the pesto pasta and the jalapeño dip! The food is always yummy

This is my favorite coffee spot. Whenever I'm in the city I need to stop here for vanilla iced coffee! Breakfast bacon croissant thing is awesome, it's made like a panini. Crepes are great and huge! Everything I've had has been excellent. Whether you're in a hurry or want to take your time this is the place!

This place has delicious food from the amazing and savory salmon pasta with large bits of it within the pasta. The actual sauce was delicious and not too thick. The waffle was huge both the sinful one and the tropical one were delicious and were not overpowering in taste. I love the food here and its not too expensive for the amazing taste.

Lattes with a kick of alcohol, crepes with nutella, ice cream, sweets, I mean nothing but great things here. I am from Los Angeles and we don't have anything like this out here or not that I know of. I've always enjoyed lattes with alcohol and they are pretty good here. I got to taste about three different ones and they were all good. I ordered the rum chata latte and loooved it! Great place for sweets and hot drinks in cold weather!
Love this place! Good food and service. The zurich crepe is my favorite. The waffles are delish too! I dined in as well as ordered out from here and both were great!

This is by far my favorite cafe! They have amazing crepes and wraps. And their PASTA! OMG! IT IS SOOOOO GOOD! I've never been to a place before that has made me happy with every single item I have ordered. Everything is delicious. You cannot go wrong with anything here!  Iguana thank you for being the greatest European cafe!  P.s. They have an actual iguana! Super cool!!
I love the desert crepes here, and the brownie a la mode is great too! I love the environment and that it's more of an intimate feeling.
Very lounge like, nice atmosphere, great sandwiches & artichoke dip.

The European dream is a freaking dream most amazing dessert it never disappoints and I have gotten each time I have gone there. There drinks are amazing and there food is great as well. The jalapeño cheese dip is great and wraps and pain is and pastas are all amazing as well. The drinks are all good and price is unbeatable the atmosphere is dark and cosy as well. The only draw back is the lack of waiters and for some reason they do not do separate checks which could such a hassle.

Visited this place several times, and i loved it! Orders took about 10-15 minutes to be ready, which was very nice. Tried the pasta with chicken breast and mushrooms, and it was delicious. The portions are pretty big, so if you aren't as hungry, one pasta for 2 people is more than enough. I couldn't even finish half of it. The drinks are reasonably priced, and the coffee is worth a try. Desserts are also huge portions, so sharing between 2 people is ideal. Will keep coming back here, in fact i am going here tonight with my girls. :)

It's been years since I have been, but it's just as good as I remember it. Amazing hummus, great wraps and sandwiches, and amazing deserts. Highly reccomend. The atmosphere is almost like a lounge. Very relaxing and laid back. Service is good, and very friendly. Secret, they have backgammon boards in the corner you can pull out to play.
Great spot for a late night dessert and drinks. A little difficult to find parking in the area...but if you can avoid having to park it's a plus.

So while visiting Chicago after dinner we ( group of 6 ) were debating what to have for dessert. Well we Yelped locations and found this place.  Showed up to this place, as you walk in it looks very intimate, quick, low key dinner/cafe type place. We would soon find out they had more than just dinner and dessert. So we the menu showed us that they had "hot" alcoholic drinks which I have had before and have been very tasty. I ended up choosing the rum latte which was nicely soft and not to strong. We also tried their crepes which were very tasty and not too sweet. I would definitely recommend this place.  Their place is not large so smaller groups would be easier to get seats but we were 6 and they were able to accommodate us.  I will be back to this place whenever i am back in Chicago.
Amazing prices and ambiance! The European waffle dessert is the best thing ever! Yummmmm!!!

This food is delish.  BUT, the service is blah.  The only person that was attentive was the busboy.  The waitress was busy socializing with the bartender and the other waitress.  I had to signal or call for her four times to order and pay the bill.  I agree with the other reviews, the waitress did not smile nor speak to you.

Lovely little cafe. We just had dessert and coffee, but both were delicious and the service was excellent.  The ambience here is relaxed, quiet, and dark. Perfect for a date, studying, having a glass of wine with a friend. If I lived in Chicago this would be my go to.
Cute little place with very generous portions. Had the Mediterranean & S'mores. Came at night, so the dim lighting was a very nice touch.

I live pretty close to Iguana and have been there several times whether it be for dinner and drinks, brunch or just stopping in for some coffee to go. I'll say that their crepes are pretty damn good, and their coffee as well. They have some decent wine selections too. My only beef on Iguana is there service. Most of the employees are foreign and I believe there is a disconnect to an average Chicagoan. They are friendly and timely in their orders but there is just something missing and I can't quite pin point it. Anyone else get this vibe? Regardless, a great atmosphere and definitely worth a try for pretty much any occasion. Hope this helps. Cheers!
Love coming here for business meetings. Can always get a table, prices are very reasonable, and can get anything to your heart's desire - from a coffee to wine to gluten free crepes :)

Came here for a group meeting. I think it's stupid that we cannot reserve.  But the portions and food was great!  Eclectic me u and I can't wait to try everything else.  Loved the European vibe and ambiance.  I had a the Lisbon crepe.. it was awesome... they have good drinks.  I can't wait to go back.

A great coffeehouse serving delicious crepes and also offering a solid menu for all day dining - all at a reasonable price. I don't live in the neighborhood so it is a bit of a trek for me but if I lived near the Iguana I would be there often.
French ever-thang!   Love the food n drank!.  This is a very pleasant place to eat and conversate.

Affordable cafe that provides late night options. Definitely a casual date spot - that dim lighting, close seating, a large iguana watching you from one story up... But really, it's definitely a date spot. I had only been for coffee before, but I stopped by on a Saturday with two friends and came in for a late lunch/early dinner and found ourselves waiting... A little too much time passed before we were able to order, and a little to much time passed before we could get the bill (even when we had asked for boxes already). Eh. We all got crepes, and they were affordable (sub $10!) and good portions. I love that they offer alcoholic coffee options! Really cozy spot with decent food at decent prices. I will return!
Great food! I had a burger wrap and my girlfriend got a pesto sandwhich and both were excellent! Good setting and staff.
This place has something that makes you feel relax, the food is great and don't forget to drink freddo cappuccino! !!! The best coffee in town! !

This place is chill, low key and pushed off from a busy intersection (including the subway that runs below) Sandwiches are simple and delicious Cheap prices  Literally, a giant iguana cage (I assume?) about a story above the dining room Will return

Iguana Café has amazing crepes. The end.  Every time I come here, my go to dessert is The Chocolate Dream crepe; it's stuffed with nutella, crushed oreos, and served with a scoop of creamy chocolate ice cream & whip cream. I'm a die hard chocolate lover, so the more chocolate, the better. TRY IT!  I know people hype the European Dream (my friend's are obsessed), but I tried it, and I didn't...really...like...it. I don't know if it was because the honey was too overwhelming for my taste buds (overly sweet), but after a few bites, I wish I had just ordered my Chocolate Dream crepe. At least the ice cream served with the waffle was good!  I recently came here to celebrate my friend's birthday. I only order dessert whenever I come here, but I decided to try their tuna sandwich. I thought I was going to be able to finish it in one sitting, but I ended up packing it and taking it home because the portions were huge. Not complaining, though. Da more food, da better.   All in all, really nice restaurant. Love the ambiance and the dim lights. Really good crepes. Will come again (as always!).
This place is right down the street from my office and I am there so frequently, they have a special button on the register for me.  I recommend the hummus plate!

Our go to late night spot. We always get the European Dream. Nutella, banana, ice cream. It's delicious! Service is decent. Ambiance works well for the cafe. I've gone with big and small groups of people. I would def recommend this place to a friend.

Really cute place with a great atmosphere.  The server was a little abrupt and I don't think she smiled at all but the crepe was good. We had the chocolate delight which comes with Oreos. It's fantastic.  Also, there are actual iguanas in here which I did not expect. Definitely recommend.

Well, this place was okay to hang out, however they are super rude here. We were there with a couple of friends and this happened twice where they said you need to get up and leave. It was 1:50 am not even 2:00 am. The way the man approached us was very rude. He could've approached us in a better way. His excuse was "I'm European and trying to adjust to the American ways." Had he just apologized and said he did not mean to approach us in that way, I would've been fine. I would not suggest to go here because that type of service kills the whole experience.

One of the places that understands crepes and coffee. I have the one with Nutella, fresh strawberries, almonds and whipped cream whenever I go, with cappuccino on the side. I can also recommend their salmon salad or sandwich. Great taste and presentation. The service is always very good and friendly, which I appreciate. Prices are very reasonable and music is always good.  Iguana has a cozy European vibe which reminds me of home.

Wasn't exactly sure what I was getting into after seeing the decor and reading the menu as it has a little bit of identity crisis, so the easiest way to describe it is a free for all european comfort food. The food itself was better than I expected, tasted super fresh, had the chicken caesar wrap which was perfectly pressed panini style and came with a side of deliciously creamy potato salad. Pricing was reasonable. The only reason I gave it 3 starts was for the lack of service, our drinks were never re-filled, waitress never came back and we had to go, get up and pay, otherwise we would still be there waiting. Perhaps, its part of the whole "european" cafe experience. Either way go prepared!

The cafe place is European and open late! The customer service is not so great! The waiters seem to only care for large groups!  I always go for the European dream with strawberries on the side and it is delicious!!  I have also tried to Neapolitan pasta and it is also good!

Cute little restaurant with nice decor and ambiance. The server though was super rushy and we felt pressured to order as quickly as possible. She came back three times to ask us if we were ready in less than 5 minutes. And would clear our plates when there was still a few bites left. Other than that again nice atmosphere and concept. The appetizer (goat cheese) was decent but something you can easily make at home with a small piece of goat cheese and tomato sauce. The crepe was great (though my French husband said they used the flour for a dessert crepe for the dinner crepes but then again it's not a French restaurant) I had the Amsterdam crepe which was the perfect blend of ingredients and a really good price for the ingredients and size. Overall a good stop if you're in the area.

Came here for dessert after dinner (Velvet Taco) around 9pm Saturday. Our group of three was seated promptly, as there were a few open tables. Soon after though, the place filled up. The space is quite interesting. It's dark and intimate but with a fun eclectic vibe as well with the art and décor. This place seemed perfect for a date night. I ended up getting a cup of the creamy tomato basil soup, a scoop of vanilla and dulce de leche ice cream and a hot pomegranate green tea. Note that their portions are quite large. I thought my cup of soup was really the bowl size. Def not complaining. The soup was delicious and loved the texture as it had chunks of tomatoes in it and wasn't quite your standard tomato basil soup. The ice cream was alright, nothing special there. The tea was perfect and also came in a giant tall mug. It had the perfect note of pomegranate and was definitely brewed with loose leaf tea. I tried my friend's 'Sweet Sin' and that was yummy. Those caramelized apples were perfect. My other friend's brownie a la mode (with mint choc chip ice cream) was good too. Our server was great, even though she appeared to be the only one for the whole place.  Definitely need to come back for dinner and try some food and more offerings. Everything seems super fresh and affordable. Also great that they are friendly to those with dietary restrictions. Location seems a bit odd but right by the Halsted #8 bus and the Grand Blue line stop and also walking distance to the West Loop-Randolph and Fulton Market areas.

Cool atmosphere, big portions, delicious crepes-- this has become a favorite date night spot for me! The two times I've been here for dinner, I've opted for pasta (oven baked in a clay bowl with a nice layer of cheese on top!) and crepes, and I definitely recommend both! The first time we came, my date and I were overenthusiastic and ordered a pasta bowl and crepe each-- oops! Way too much food! This past time we shared an appetizer (crab dip- yum!), the carbonara pasta, and a crepe. Even that was too much food!  It looks like everything on the menu is delicious, but I'd say order conservatively-- you can always tack on a crepe or five at the end if it's not enough food ;)

Just got a simple vanilla milkshake and let me tell you it is the best shake I have had in a long time. As I was waiting for it I saw them bringing out some delicious looking crepes that I will be back to try!

Decent small place, we went in there last week for brunch. We went more for the food advertised than the coffee part. Overall an ok place except for one huge detail, see below at the last comments. I had one of there crepes, it was good, a little sloppier than id prefer butit still tasted good. We shared the crab/cheese dip app and it was also very good. In fact it was probably the best tasting thing of the whole time we were there. My wife had the chicken sandwich and complained it was very dry.  The staff didnt seem too motivated to be serving but we were there early around noon, not sure if thats an excuse or not but whatever. Our server cracked a smile here and there but nothing that made you feel comfortable or made you want to jump at the idea of goin back soon. Pricing was ok i guess, although I can count on one hand an easy number of places that serve much better food in larger portions for the same prices if not less.  Overall it wasnt horrible and if I happen to be in the area and hungry enough I may stop by again. One of my BIGGEST disappointments was their Bloody Mary.... After a night of normal drinking and waking up the next morning hungry for a good meal and thirsty for a nice hearty Bloody Mary to just start your day off right and set you up for a good day, a place like this you would imagine might offer just that right bloody for ya. Nope, it literally was like they cracked open a store brand can of tomato juice and added vodka to it, thats it! My wife is an experienced bartender so on top of me knowing good drinks thanks to her I also know and understand the level of certain places a place can offer and what can be expected. But there was honestly no excuse for this poor Bloody Mary. They couldve AT LEAST added some lime, and 3 olives as a garnish and it wouldve been an attempt, hell a pickle, celery stick. Salt on the rim, SOMETHING. Haha i never expect a fancy tower of garnishes and a bloody mary that has to be prepared by a chef type of deal but like I said...its not hard to put a toothpick through 3 olives, a squirt of lime and maybe a dash or two of hot sauce and your off to a good start lol. A couple bottles of either Zing Zang or Tobasco's bloody mixes to have around would make a WORLD of difference and still keep your cost down.  PS. The live Iguana is in a small window on the back far left side of the wall all the way up top lol
This is 1 of my favorite places in the city. Definitely the best Freddo cafe, food and crepes. The staff is super friend and place is super clean. I highly recommend it.
I tried their bruschetta for takeout once and it simply put was inedible - it was extremely oily and over seasoned. Needless to say, I won't be back.

Food is good, sometimes the kitchen and waitstaff don't communicate the best and orders are missed. Other times, I get the best service I have ever had. I love the beautiful girls that work here. I hope they find rich guys to marry! They are so sweet. Pasta salad is yummy. Also, the art on the wall is really, really good! Great taste in art!

Incredibly rude service.  Absolutely condescending. Totally over complicated the payment process of a large group. Will not be coming back here, ever.  You can find better fid in the city of Chicago with better service.

Not too bad....we stopped here for an evening coffee and dessert.  Probably should have only ordered a half serving as the full was quite much.  It's been a while since I visited this establishment so I don't remember specifics but I would return.

This is my favorite go-to spot for a late night grab. I've never ordered there dinner menu but their crepes are one of the best! I also love the Bailey's chocolate drink. It has a very quiet abd sophisticated ambience.  Any crepe you order will always fill you up. Price is pretty decent, since crepes at any good restaurant will be a little pricey. The service is okay, nothing really outstanding. You don't really have to call for a reservation unless you have a big party. If you don't love crepes, you will fall in love with it here!

The place is kind of dim with candles at every table for a romantic vibe.  I really like this place because it's really chill,  not too formal and the food is good without having to sacrifice your wallet. I normally get a dessert crepe(Ice cream, nutella and strawberries), but occasionally I will get real food(like pasta). I pretty much have enjoyed everything that I have tried on the menu.  The only thing is that even though it does give you a quiet and intimate vibe, sometimes there are people that come here that disrupt the quiet, but its not the cafe's fault. The tables are a little cramped but overall the place is cute.  P.S. they have real iguanas hanging out in a tank built into the wall.

Immediate reaction after eating: loved it, amazing and filling crepes, reasonable priced, yummy chai latte and iguana special frappe, lovely and friendly staff Was walking around after visiting blommer chocolate factory store and on a lark and with the guidance of yelpers decided to stop in for brunch. On a random Monday at 1130, there were a few tables and some people stopping in for a quick coffee to go. So we got a table for 2 and ordered drinks first and got a cold iguana special frappe and a hot chai latte, both were excellent and I usually don't like chai latte and I drank every drop! Then we ordered the the savory crepes (though we heard so many great things about the dessert ones), my wife got the Sparta (with spinach feta, mushrooms, tomatoes and chicken) and I got a create your own crepe which included Italian sausage, fresh mozzarella cheese, black olives and avocado...we kept a menu cause we were worried it was not going to be enough food, but when the food came out we were extremely pleasantly surprised by the size of the crepes and the amount of ingredients inside, and the crepe itself was so yummy, it came with this sauce that was a perfect pairing with the crepes...the server was extremely nice and the water girl was on the ball and very attentive to my water drinking needs (which I love) all in all we brought some of the crepe home and were really happy with everything!

Just randomly Yelp and found this place.. Love the crepe and their selections!! The iced cappuccino is good!! The atmosphere is great!! Totally recommend to my friends who love crepe even to my friends who loves beer.. Can't wait to go back to try their breakfast or brunch

We met here for a book club, and I thought it was a good place for a group to meet--had decent parking (had to go over a couple blocks), quiet enough to have a conversation without yelling, spacious, etc. The food was just okay--I would not come here specifically for the food, but it worked well for the purposes that I came there for, so I give it four stars.
Coffee tasted great. Bruschetta is absolutely delicious and only $6! Staff are all friendly and attentive too.

This place has a nice, relaxed atmosphere and a huge menu of reasonably priced items to choose from.  For the atmosphere, and the service, I would give it a 4.  But, the food and drinks just weren't that good.  Not bad, just not special.  My pasta dish was okay, but would have been better with more vegetables.  The artichoke spinach dip was not creamy like one would expect, probably because it was mostly spinach.  For drinks I got a mojito and a pomegranate martini.  Both were a little weak, a little too sweet.  So, not bad, just not special.

It was late night and I was our craving something sweet so I decided to check the place out based on the reviews and I was not disappointed at all. Service was friendly and helpful and the food and drinks were amazing. I definitely want to come back for breakfast when I'm in the area

Great spot for lunch or just dessert and drinks! Ordered a variety of items on their menu including wraps and sandwiches, coffee, and savory crepes. All tasted excellent! Free wifi is a plus for working on the go.

HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! I've never had such horrible service in Chicago. The owner or manager was SOO rude. We would ask him simple questions about splitting the bill and he got very upset. It was just a simple question.  The waitress just ignored us when we were trying to ask questions about the menu. At the end of the night I told him, his food is good but him and his staff need to work on their customer service, he just denied everything and was rolling his eyes. Very unprofessional! Never coming back here.

I have been a regular to this place for the past two years. However, tonight will be my very last time. A group of four of us entered the cafe. We were given a small round table that only seats two people. I had asked the waitress to bring another table. Instead of answering my simple request, she just ran away without even communicating to us. We were later told that the table cannot be given to us because they were reserved. I only saw reserved signs on one of the tables, whereas the other table was clearly free. I decided to let it go and enjoy my meal. When it was time to pay the bill, we were given one check. Being an avid foodie in Chicago, it is customary to give separate checks for the convenience of the customers. Instead, we were told to only pay one bill. He suggested to use the ATM which would be an additional  2.25 charge. We offered to give our individual credit card information for each customer, he still did not oblige. He did not try and help us in any way.  Although the food is good, the cafe did not treat their customers respectively. The waitress was rude, and the manager did not offer us any comfort during our dining experience. We were forced to eat in a crammed table and had a dispute on how to pay the bill. I am giving this cafe 1 star due to the terrible way they treated their customers, especially to a regular. Thank goodness Chicago is full of other great restaurants!
we went for some drinks and appetizers and were not disappointed. the cheesy crab dip was extremely tasty and the mozzarella basil plate was refreshing. this was a great find for us out of towners.

This place can sometimes practically be my kitchen. I live in the neighborhood and I am always here. As I write this, the bruschetta is in front of me. They carry a nice stock of teas black and white for hot or iced consumption. They can make all the fancy drinks you can think of. I have never had bad service here, disclaimer I am in the service industry so I get along with staff and we speak the same language. I recommend any of the pastas, in the mood for crepes, they are superb. Desire desert, they have you covered with ice creams, fruits, waffles, desert crepes and much more. Just don't go in and try to buy one thing for five people and then expect to split it five ways on a credit card, that's rude.

Amazing food, great price for Chicago.  Small but large in taste.  Nice atmosphere if you are looking for an out of the way place for a glass of wine and great crepes with anything you can imagine.  Even chocolate and fruit.  My kids loved it!
The carbonara and bruschetta were excellent. We went end of shift. The kitchen closes about 1:30am but the drive was worth it from Rosemont. I'm from Tampa and I will definitely come back!

I love this place and I always feel welcome when I come here (which isn't as often as I'd like, due to the location being far from my apartment).  After reading some really negative reviews here I decided to give my two cents and explain why I love this place so much. In the process I plan on addressing some of the complaints I've seen on their yelp page.  Firstly, the coffee shop is very nicely decorated and isn't crammed at all. So, coming here for an afternoon get together with friends over some coffee and food is aesthetically pleasing. I was always greeted by the staff nicely and felt welcome. Speaking of the staff, one of you guys is owed a huge thank you for helping me get my friend out of the restroom that wasn't even locked (said friend is simply confused by how doors work). Thanks for helping and laughing it off.  Since I've been here quite a few times I can speak for several dishes that I personally enjoy:  Savory- Italian sandwich (get the potato salad as a side, much better pairing than pasta salad), carbonara and napolitan pasta, tirokafteri and the Mediterranean plate are great appetizers. They make a good club sandwich as well. If you want a lighter option their salmon salad is a good choice. Sweet- the Greek yogurt and Nutella & banana crepe.  Coffee- I've tried a bunch of their coffees, they make European style coffees that taste great. But I'm not going to give suggestions for the coffee, they have so many options I can only suggest you get adventurous and try something you haven't had before, or explore the different syrup options for a custom drink.  Now that food and drinks are covered lets talk about the service pace. Yes, it takes a while to get the check. The famed European style service that I hear about and experience a lot when dining in Eastern European places around town (and, well, in Eastern Europe in general) is present here as well. It truly is a thing, and I firmly believe it is due to trying not to have the patrons feel rushed, as opposed to what others have said (facebooking and ignoring patrons for no reason). Having that said, your water glasses will always be full and you will have ample opportunity to order additional items off the menu if you so choose. In a hurry? Don't appreciate the European dining pace? Me too! So now that you've been warned, make sure to mention to your server that you'd like the check to come out with your food and it will. Problem solved.  As for the review about split checks and being forced to order food... I split checks just about every other time I go here and it is never a problem. You were asked to order something at a place of business that offers food and beverages? How shocking! Iguana might have a homey feel to it but you are not, in fact, in your own living room.  Another thing I should mention for those that live or work around the area but are in a rush and don't have time to sit down and enjoy a meal- call them about 15 minutes before you can come in and place a to go order, your food will be waiting for you and you can merrily go on with your day. Iguana saved me from plenty of bad lunch option days at UIC.

Came here late on a Saturday nite and found the vibe to be relaxed and lounge-y. It was mostly groups and even a couple families. The menu featured beer, wine, cocktails, coffee, food, and desserts. The hours are 8am-2am and it seems like they were well equipped to serve all three meals plus cater to the late night crowd.  I had the hot chocolate with baileys, European Dream Belgian waffle, and the caramel crepe (can't remember the exact name). Everything was delicious, flavorful, and very rich. In my opinion, the portions were generous considering the price. My friend and I easily could've shared one dessert instead of getting two.  The service was fairly good although it took the waitress a little while to come to our table initially and then to take our checks at the end. This seems like a place that people tend to stay at for quite a while so perhaps the staff doesn't want to usher customers out. The waitress was very friendly and more than willing to recommend items on the menu. Someone would also come around and refill my water if it was even half empty. Overall, this place was great and I plan to return! Also, if you look toward the left on the back wall, you'll notice they have a pet iguana :)

This place has a relaxed and casual vibe.  They offer a ton of different items, but my friends went for the crepes.  While I'm usually not a crepe person, these were actually pretty good.  They have a nice menu since there's a ton to choose from and there's enough to keep everyone happy. Very reasonably priced as well!

This is my favorite restaurant in the neighborhood, if not the entire city itself. Firstly, all types of food, available all the time. I can get the best sweet crepes in town at 2 am. Secondly, their Pasta Carbonora is the best in the city, around 10 bucks, and there is always some to share or take home. Thirdly, the coffee and drinks are delicious and potent.  The staff is European mostly and super friendly. This is a must go in Chicago.

My go to place! We are there almost every week, typing/working away in our favorite spot for 7 to 8 hours, eating delicious crepes, great mochas and awessommmee baked pastas. Fracking great food, authentic ambiance, attentive staff and prompt service. These guys are exceptional.  We've also had several date nights and late night eats. IGCafe is one of my fav spots in the city! FAVORITES: Amsterdam Savory Crepe with onions and Tempting Trio Sweet Crepe with strawberries instead of bananas; mocha with almond milk and their baked pastas! YUMMM

The decor is amazing. It such a cute little cafe. But upon arrival, we took the hostess a moment to sat us down. That should have been a trigger that everything else was going to be a wait. It took awhile for our crepe to come out when we ordered it the same time as our other food items. Then afterwards, the waitress too so long that we didn't even bother waiting on her to ask for our check so we just paid at the counter instead. It could have been a 4-star if their service was a bit better.  I had a croissant sandwich with sausage, egg & provolone. Nothing out of the ordinary. Simple and savory.  The table got a hummus plate to share and the hummus was really creamy so it was pretty good. I would recommend sharing this as an appetizer.  We also had the creamy caramel creations and the dulce de leche ice cream was what made it stand out. Really good crepe just wish there was more ice cream dab on top.  Can't wait to try other crepes!

Iguana Café never disappoints. It is the perfect place to catch up friends, especially for desserts and coffee. What makes it ideal for meet-ups is that it is open late [until 2 AM].  My go-to crepe is the chocolate monkey: nutella, banana, and a scoop of vanilla ice cream.  It truly is a taste of Europe.
Had a crepe and a couple of drinks here today for lunch. Everything tasted awesome, server was super friendly and helpful. Totally recommend this place.
I had Bougasta and nescafe. Pretty decent combination. I know what to order next here. This place is open late which is big plus.

This place was a great surprise! I've passed it many times during the day and it was a welcoming coffee shop. However I went at night for the first time and was pleasantly surprised to find a vibrant, European-style atmosphere. Coffee and full bar options along with desserts or full meals. I had a delicious cappuccino and chocolate cake. My friend had the bougatsa, which was a nice, different option. Live music was a nice touch, enjoyable, but not so loud that you couldn't still hold a conversation. Service was good. I'm really looking forward to going back and trying the crepes.
Had breakfast with my boyfriend .... we enjoyed their crepes!  Servers are very friendly ...loved the ambience and the decor..it's a good place for brunch too!!

At this moment and time - (past 12am) I'm thankful we have places open like this, especially when you have an early flight to another state- it's conveniently nearby the blue line train station which takes you to the airport. Anyways I had the bougatsa - I looked at the other reviews and thought I have a late night dessert. It was my first time, I had the genius idea to put Nutella on the ice cream one... Big mistake - it was too sweet.  But it was good for first time, it had its flaky crunchy texture on areas not drizzled by caramel or the Nutella and the creaminess and cool ice cream made the temperature hot dessert more enjoyable.  Atmosphere is comfortable to talk at night, the worker/busser always hussles to take away trash, and refill your water.  I was thankful it was opened conveniently for me to get a little dessert and figure some things out- thanks  If I ever come back from California - I'll try something else and give another rating. :)

We've come to this place twice already and this place is absolutely amazing. My girlfriends addicted to this place is great. All I highly recommend  chocolate banana crêpe. They also have amazing tomato basil soup. Very nice chill place to hang out with friends. This place has high reviews for a reason and gets pretty populated at certain times of the day. If you're in this area I highly recommend that you check this place out at least one time. Enjoy... Add me for more updated and reviews

the food is amazing! we got the pesto and carbonera pastas and they were delicious! the crepes were even better! Our service was excellent Nadia was our server, she was fast, had a great personality, and was very attentive! you will not regret coming here!
Went with a group of 5 and had a great time!  Cheap drinks and great food and, best of all, a relaxed atmosphere where we felt we could hang out and not be hassled.  We'll be back!

Best place for late night out, i loved their dessert boogasta with ice cream, never had anything like this before...we had a savory crepe, iguana cafe specialty and espresso. Its an affordable place to be to have fun!!

The only late night cafe in the area/intersection.  It can get busy, but you never feel that you have to leave.  A true European Cafe where you can enjoy coffee and alcoholic beverages. AFFORDABLE DATE VENUE -- dark, intimate and you can still hear and see your date.  I can't say romantic as there is a TV screen.  Easy commute with access to CTA Blue Line Grand stop. GOURMET EUROPEAN CAKES -- it is popular cakes made by a Greek bakery.  Skip the Red Velvet Cake.  I did enjoy the non-Mexican Tres Leches (the cake icing was odd).  Maybe the cheesecake is a better option, and I am slightly curious if it is European or American cheesecake. BOUGATSA -- a reliable dessert that is unique.  I haven't seen it on many menus. MENU -- diverse from salads, crepes, sandwiches, croissant. PARKING -- limited FREE parking on the west side after the mini bridge and before Iguana Cafe.
Great food. Great value. Comfortable vibe. European chic feel.  People come for the crepes among other things. I love this place. Service is excellent too.

Cute neighborhood cafe with good crepes, but not great.  I came for a date, and was glad the menu only included foods that can be ordered, served and eaten within 30 minutes.  I think this is actually the perfect first date spot because they serve both coffee and drinks, and afternoon nibbles.  The sparkling wine I had was delicious, and the service was perfect.  The ambiance was private, and mellow and crowded, but not loud.  A nice place for a quick bite, but not top on my list.

Maybe it's because I'm from California that this place is so impressive, but this place is open LATE and their food is super affordable. The food is decent, with a lot of the grilled chicken tasting like it's pre-packaged. The crepes are really good though, my favorite being the "canoli" crepe. Kitchen closes at 12, even though their shop closes at 12:30.

A default option for a Friday night around 11 pm when you're in the mood to catch up with a group of friends over crepes and coffee. The venue is best described as nestled in the West Loop in a fairly active area yet detached from the hyper activity typical of a Friday night and strikes the right balance of "Euro-Lounge" meets nighttime hangout spot. My go-to options are the Nutella+Peanut Butter Crepe and the large iced frappe (no sugar). Service is quick and the prices are reasonable. Certainly one of the few staples in my venue list that is recurring and a good fall back choice when everyone is in the mood to keep it casual-social.

Amazing food. Love the chocolate delight crepes. So good. I've gotten them at least four times now. There food is great and i always will go there for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. There service is amazing. Very sweet and caring. They talk very nicely and are very hospitable that makes a difference for me. I won't go anywhere if they are rude and disrespectful. So keep up the amazing work. I will come again soon! :)

This is an awesome place that feels like a secret hideaway of drinks and food. If you are one of these people that only go to River North and the West Loop just because of the boundary with the river that says in your brain "I can only go to Japonais and then I have to turn back" because this is a gem of a place. It's got this vibe that you would find in eastern europe like in prague or something. It has that hideaway type feel I have fallen in love with the salads especially the smoked salmon salad. Together with the creamy vinagrette, the smoked salmon ( ie lox )and the avocado brings forth a really tasty meal. I will continue coming hear. A real gem. Service is 2nd to none. they have a decent late night scene

Came here with my bf and friend for a quick bite and was very pleasantly surprised.  This place can be somewhere to hunker down with your laptop and coffee, or to have a quick bite.  The crepes are tasty and can be gluten free.  We opted for a make your own goat cheese/spinach/tomato, the tempting trio, and an order of crab dip.  We watched a little bit of NCAA bball, had a beer, and enjoyed ourselves.  Nice little spot.
Amazing!!! It's a ritual, every saturday morning before  i start my work day, im getting creeps. The best!!!
This place is a neighborhood favorite. The staff is so friendly, and the food is delicious for a fantastic price! Highly recommended!

So I've been here with Wifey a few times already.  She recommended it as she used to come here on occasion in the past.  So we did.   The place is nice and quaint inside.  The decor is cool, is laid back, cozy, very chill.  People are chatting or working on their laptops or reading a good book even.   The menu is quite extensive for a small cafe, it has more food options than you would get at other cafes.  They have crepes, sandwiches, salads and pasta.. yes pasta.  Which looks pretty good and I wouldn't mind trying one of these days.  We've had the tomato basil soup, a little watered down for my taste.  Could be thicker.  I've had the Chicken cesar salad... pretty bland and eh.. nothing to rave about.  My wife always orders a veggie wrap that she just adores, so kudos for having something Wifey gets cravings for.  I WANTED to try the espresso and lemon sorbeto, BUT a waitress never came by to see if we needed anything else.. see below ;) It has a very European vibe to it... and I think it shows in the service, verrrrry European as in sit down.. do you want to order? what is it?  I'll see you again in an hour.   The service has been very subpar.  The last time we were there, our first waitress just left with out letting us know and was replaced with another one who didnt even visit our table once.  We sat there after finishing our entrees for at least 40 minutes and finished our drinks with out one visit as the rest of the tables around us got some new attention by miss yoga pants (every waitress looks like they just got back from the gym).  Oh and there's only one waitress for the whole place.  Hey I get it, its small, you don't need a lot of staff.  but c'mon, she was behind this little bar area facebooking or something more important obviously. I'm not in love with the place nor do I hate it.  The food selection is good on a nice afternoon on the weekend or even a late night visit during the week.  Iguana.. I'm going to try the pasta next time and see what's up.  Give me love baby!

So a friend told me about this place. That same friend so took me there for the first time. I had the Chicken Florentine and it was succulent. The chicken we moist,  the pasta was great overall. What I really liked was the the small charming and intimate vibe then place has. Would be a great date spot... Especially since the beer and drinks in general are priced to move. You know what I'm talking about. I also tried the the assorted meat and sausage appetizer. It was pretty good but the meatloaf practically melts on your mouth. I'm definitely trying the meatloaf sandwich next time. Our waitress was great, very attentive.

I'm definitely a fan! We've seen IC many times and just thought of it as a coffee hangout which didn't really appeal to us.  Boy, were we wrong as it is so much more!  In fact, it has quickly become our go-to spot for good food, good cocktails, great service and awesome ambiance. I highly recommend the key lime martini but my absolute favorite is the french martini.  If you are a fan of Chambord then you will be saying OOO La La in no time flat!  For food, they are very accommodating to their vegan friends.  I have had the hummus and the pasta with tomato sauce and neither of those disappointed me.  I look forward to many, many trips in the future so I can try some of the other menu items such as the veggie sandwich. I think the two things that really keep us coming back are the amazing prices and amazing service.  I am remiss that I have not gotten our server's name yet but look forward to updating this review with her name.  She is on top of it and always friendly and knowledgable. I highly recommend giving IC a shot (I hear the crepes are divine) because I recommend it to all my friends and family.
Yum yum yum!!! Best crepes in town! I think I've tried all of them. Almond joy is my fav (so far). Me and my boyfriend love this place. Service is great. Drinks both hot/cold are great as well!

What a great cafe!!! This was my first stop coming from O'hare to downtown Chicago.  Service started off kind of slow at first. I probably sat around for 15-20minutes before a waiter came up to me to take my order. I wasn't too mad about it but I might have when I realized how good the food was.  I just wanted to eat some kind of lunch quickly before continuing on to downtown Chicago but I ended up staying here for 2 hours! I ordered a white mocha latte, carbonara pasta, and the "Tempting Trio" crepe (nutella, banana, strawberries). Let's just say the portions are more than welcoming for its price.
