I had leftovers from the carbonara pasta and I would have had leftovers from the crepe too but I finished that with pride. There's alot of variety to the menu and I hope to come back one day and try more things!

One of my favorite cafes in the city. I've introduced several of my friends to this place and they love it too.  Great food, very fair prices and laid-back, lounge atmosphere!  I recommend the Sparta (savory) crepe or the Tempting Trio (dessert) crepe, but honestly you can't go wrong with anything you order here.
Love this place! Reasonable prices and great service. The crepes are the best in Chicago in my opinion, great drinks too

First time trying a crepe (Nutella w/ a scoop of vanilla ice cream)..and WOW..it was great!!!   Made my own panini and wasn't that crazy for it :(  Also tried the chicken pepper wrap..and it had too many green and red peppers  Would just be coming here for a crepe :)))))
I live this cute little spot that makes me so happy. Awesome food, amazing coffee and the service is great. Such a cozy spot, away from everyone and everything else.

Why didn't I discover this place earlier? Such a hidden gem in this area.  I went in for lunch today and really had an amazing experience. Mediterranean sandwich was grilled/pressed to perfection and sesame seeds filled bread helped to add a crunch. The filling was simple and healthy.  Service spot on and all staff members were friendly. After my meal I picked a cappuccino with hazelnut flavor and it was just plain delicious! The waitress told me to taste it before I add any sugar and after tasting I knew that it didn't need any sugar at all.  A few other things to note 1. Street parking only - which can be a bit tricky depending on when you arrive 2. They are known for their crepes - I hope to try them next time 3. They do have a full bar and an extensive selection of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. 4. Prices are reasonable for the area 5. They provide free wifi - ask them for the password

Iguana Cafe is a great place to visit.  The food is excellent, the service is great and the price is perfect.  The decor is very relaxing for day or night meet ups. I'm surprised this place is not on a reservation basis only. I hope it never does go that route.  The only negative thing I might be able to say is regarding the street parking only.  Expect to stay about an hour and an half.

Great atmosphere. Go dressy or casual and you'll fit right it. Intimate place, good for first dates probably. Not too expensive for the quality of food! Good menu, I had some awesome bacon and Gouda crepes. Awesome first experience!
Great menu, many vegetarian options, amazing goat cheese apps & entrees, space great for coffee, solo meal, or small group.  Great coffee, great bar!

Gluten free crepes for 50 cents extra. This goes for entrees and desserts. So good. Soy milk (and I think almond) in coffee was I think about 50 cents too. Very reasonable adjustments. Service was okay but food was delicious. I hope to come back here soon!

Who doesn't love a great European Cafe in the city! Iguana Cafe has been a neighborhood favorite for years. The menu has wide variety from salad,soup and pastas. The Mediterranean Feast is always my go to with a great cup of coffee on Fridays after a long work week. Great atmosphere with friendly staff!
Hanging out with my girl for her birthday! I will be coming back with my fiancé! Creamy crab dip is delicious and service was great!
This place actually has iguanas!  And, the dessert/drinks and ambiance are awesome.

Entrees are so so. Nothing special, tastes like homemade cooking. Service also wasn't great. Plus points are the ambience and the crepes menu which has a huge selection. Next time would only come back for late night dessert.
The inside of this place looks awesome! It's like a cozy coffee shop and a bar mixed into one. The people here are super nice and the food is delicious!
The portion sizes are very large.  Though the food isn't particularly original, it is inexpensive.  I like that it's very easy to find parking.

I love this place. I discovered it over the summer and have been multiple times. The service is great, food is on point, and atmosphere is tremendous. Very casual, yet classy. I'm a fan of the gluten free prague crepe, while my boyfriend has tried numerous items off the menu and enjoyed them all. The almond joy crepe and chocolate peanut butter crepe are also delicious. I'm never disappointed when I come here. It's a great place for groups and if you're coming alone as well.
The desserts are good. I ordered the Banana Spilit . it was really good and so are the drinks. I would come back here again. I recommend to other people.
The peach margarita was delicious and pasta cabonara was enjoyable! Very intimate setting; perfect for dates!

Absolutely and wholeheartedly recommend this joint as I've always had such a pleasant experience. The prices are fair, the service is excellent, and the food is delicious (paninis and crepes for dayzzzzz, also margaritas and mojitos and espresso and wine and...). The lighting is dark and can be all romantic and what not if you're into that, but more importantly, every time I've been there they've had some type of game on. Thumbs up.

Hi Iguana owners, Thank you goes to my servers for many years of fun and get togethers at Iguana. Unfortunately I had a pretty bad experience last Saturday with (I was told by the Manager, 'the Boss'). I hosted my b-day party, just like last year, at your coffee shop. First of, "the Boss" was very rude as soon as I walked in. I had around 20 guests, which was discussed in the beginning of the week. Nothing was properly organized. I was given attitude by the Boss when I asked to rearrange the tables a bit so it can accommodate my guests, and we are not all sitting waching eachothers backs. He was very rude and didn't help at all. We all witnessed his unprofessional behavior and decided only to stay since it was too late to go any other place with this large group of people. I didn't catch your name, since you never introduced yourself to me. I was very surprised when I was told this guy who just walked up to me and started giving me attitude was actually the Boss. If you are dealing with people, especially guests that bring you business, change your attitude and learn how to respect. I read/heard other negative comments about Iguana and staff attitude. I personally never had any problems with the rest of the staff. However, please take these comments seriously if your goal is to make your customers happy. There are many coffee shops out there with great customer service that will be more then happy to get new customers and host parties.
Service is the best. Food like the pastas and panini s are the best .  Good atmosphere.  Great prices  Love it

I secretly want to give this place 1 star so everyone stays away and I can enjoy this awesome place all to myself....but I can't spend enough to keep it open.  Great Great place....perfect decor, great staff and the BEST crepes in Chicago! 5 plus stars!

Came here on Friday night around 1015 pm with a group of 5 people. Waited 20 mins for the table. Environment is dark and it's pretty crowded! We came here for desserts so we ordered a waffle, crepe and a Greek dessert with custard! None of the desserts were really good! But they were big portions and cheap! The service was friendly but it took a long time for them to seat us and take our order! I think they were maybe understaffed but the we noticed the waitress took the order of a couple people that got seated after us! I will consider coming back here to try other dishes in the future.
I ordered a salad while waiting for the bus, and was assured it would be ready in time. It wasn't. Paid for food I didn't receive- thanks.

Ok, this place is bomb. First of all, their customer service is very friendly. Secondly, their drinks taste awesome. I did not get a chance to eat here yet, but I heard it's pretty good. Last but not least, their drink servings are HUGE! It's 2 to 3 times the typical serving for half the price! I feel guilty only drinking beverages there, that's how awesome this place is. Give it a shot for sure guys.

I went here for the first time the other night and it was wonderful. I had the pasta con tomato which was cooked in a clay bowl and it was amazing -- so much food that I took half of it home for lunch the next day. My roommate ordered a custom made crepe and she loved it. For drinks I had the chai which was just ok -- it was a little warmer than lukewarm. My roommate had the pumpkin spice latte which she thought was just ok -- I didn't try it so can't judge it. For desert we had the waffle with ice cream and Nutella -- yum!! Would love to give this place 5 stars but service was a little slow. However I look forward to going back soon -- the food was that good and not expensive.
Awesome food, and trust me I know a thing or 2 about crepes. Lots of options, great quality ingredients. Less than attentive server. But great prices as well
There is nothing wrong in this place, good food, good ambience and I love the nutella crepe, If you are in the area, give it a shot and I think you will like it!

My favorite place to have breakfast in Chicago ! Pair their mimosa with crepes or omlete and enjoy this simple, but vibrant place. I also like their appetizer menu, everything is tasty and the portions are generous.    if you happened to be in the neighborhood in the afternoon or evening, stop by for a glass of wine and observe the guests.  The place is getting busy and fun around 9pm. The parking could be a hassle,  but if you opt for a short walk, park few blocks away or behind the building (can't remember the name of the street).

I saw this place on the show called Check Please. It's a quaint little place where you can go anytime of the day even late at night since they are open late. I had there food there and it's really tasty especially their crepes. I love there hot chocolate and their cappuccino. It's a place where u can hang out to study, meet up with some friends to catch up or go after watching a movie having a hankering for a late snack. This is a place I would recommend to others to go if they just want to unwind.

They do bougatsa better than anyone else. It may not be the most traditional take on this custardy dessert but in my opinion it is the best anywhere. Make sure to get it with nutella and dulce de leche ice cream

Long overdue on this review after going here at least 10 times now...we've actually only sat down and ate once as this has become my go-to to-go spot. Love to belly up at the little bar (sshhh...usually no one sits there), enjoy a 16 oz Grolsch and put in our dinner order. Very European ambiance in that you'll see tables having coffee and/or wine and/or beer...all mixed instead of the usual segregation of coffee & booze you see in this country. Anything baked in the clay bowls is delicious but I've unfortunately become severely addicted to the panini grilled wraps, specifically the Spicy Chicken Pepper Wrap...love that damn thing. This is a consistent and very reasonably priced Euro-cafe with delicious food serving any type of drink you're in the mood for...great spot.

Been here a few times for meetings and the occasional dinner.  Crepes are fantastic!  Can't get anything better in Chicago.  Service is great and I can usually find parking in the area, surprisingly! Great food and service!

This place was about to be 5 stars if it weren't for our server. The place is a real chill lounge. They have real iguanas. The menu has great options for amazing prices. I ended up getting a savory crepe. It was giant and delicious. I also ordered a beer and that was pretty cheap. My friends and I split a sweet caramel crepe at the end of the meal, with ice cream on top. I can't say enough good things about it. Then I had to grab a train to the burbs and stopped our waitress and explained that it was pretty urgent to get my receipt and told her I needed to catch a train. She says ok, then turns around and asks another couple of tables if they wanted to order any food... Really?! I told you I needed the check. That was blatantly rude. So like I said, it brought my experience for a total 5 all the way through, to a 4... I had to sprint to the train just to make it on time. Which is not fun with 1 and a half crepes in your stomach...

Moved to River West a year ago, and this is my new go-to place to meet for coffee.  They make one of the best lattes in Chicago, steaming hot with lots of foam, served in an oversized stoneware cup.  I pair it with a half-serving of bougatsa, a custard wrapped in phyllo , topped with Nutella, dusted with powdered sugar and served warm.  Sure beats the boring pastries at Starbucks.    But the main attraction here are the crepes.  I'm trying to cut down on gluten, so I split a  gluten-free desert crepe with bananas and strawberries, and it was yummy.  (Leave your carb counter at the front door.)  Lots of Mediterranean influences like spinach pie, fresh wraps and sandwiches, and a good selection of dinner entrees.  My favorite salad is the smoked salmon, which doesn't look like much when it arrives, but is light with fresh ingredients.  Love both the Mediterranean cafe ambience and the affordable pricing.  There's an okay wine list (the reds are better than the whites), and a tiny stand-up bar.  Good selection of bottled beer, including my favorite Guinness.   Some reviewers have commented on the slow service, which has occasionally been a problem when it's busy, but I prefer it to being rushed to make way for the next diners.  Plenty of paid street parking.  One suggestion to the owners:  add  an omelet to the menu... took a family group here for brunch a few months ago, and there were no egg choices for the protein lovers.
I love this place. it has very small menu but the food is awesome. Capuchino freddo is my favorite coffee in the house. great place for lunch.

I've given this place two tries in the past month bc the food is great. The service, on the other hand, is horrible. Servers are rude and unfriendly and SLOW. We ended up leaving after only one drink after an hour, when we could easily had a few rounds in the time. Not worth it!

Crepes crepes crepes. If you serve me up a tasty crepe in a cute environment, it's hard for me not to crush on you, Thus, it's no surprise that Iguana Cafe earns four stars from me! Plus, there's a good number of parking spots on both sides of the street...easy access!  Inside, Iguana Cafe boasts lofty plank ceilings, a small bar, plenty of tables/half booths, and free WiFi. I will note, however, the free WiFi was pretty spotty when I worked here for a few hours, so you may want a back up just in case. Other points of note... Service: Super on point, friendly and quick! The food came flying out of the kitchen and my water was always kept full.  Food: My Berlin crepe (turkey, provolone cheese, tomatoes & cucumber) was flavorful and just the right texture, especially when I subbed gouda for provolone. I really enjoyed the sauce that came on the side, too.  Ambiance: Background music was a little loud near the front windows, so if you have really concentrated work to get through, this may not be the spot for you.  Price: Just right, especially for the sizable crepe I was served. One thing I was surprised about, though, was that I had to pay for a refill for my iced tea/lemonade combo. A bit odd, IMO... Considering the convenience and taste factors combined, Iguana Cafe is a great pick for a quick lunch and some co-working!

Awesome food! The serving are too huge and cannot be finished by one person alone. I had crepes and pasta. Both were a good eat. I will definitely come back. Seeing a real Iguana in a case was fun and unexpected!
Finally visited iguana cafe and will be back often! The good, service, ambiance - everything was so good! Extensive menu and very affordable.

ummm... It'd be nice if iguana cafe could pretend to care more and source their crepes from a place that makes it less obvious that the crepes are not being made as we order it.  Do you guys even have crepe batter onsite?  If so, are you making all your crepes in the morning and letting it sit out all day so it has the texture of a wrap by the time someone orders a crepe at night?  I can imagine it's hard to keep up with the night time rush if you make your crepes on site and as they are ordered, but seriously, fix this.  The last time I came here, the crepes were soft, tender, and juicy.  This time -- I think an umbrella made out of your crepes can protect me from the chicago rain/snow.

Salad was a salad I could make better at home. Not your typical ceasar salad that you get mixed with the dressing and nice shredded cheese on top. Croutons are served on the side with the mediocre dressing and chopped lettuce with tomatoes on a plate.  I did not get a hello, welcome to Cafe Iguana,the man just came up and gave me the menu, once I said hello and smiled, not a budge, just walked away.  My waiter did the same, are you ready, took my order, when I asked her for the WiFi pw, I asked her if any of the letters were in caps and she said "I DON'T KNOW" like my question so bizarre. I received the check and once again no thank you for dining with us, etc I gave her the 20% tip because I am nice and I know that's what their money BUT I will not be coming back nor recommend.  Iguana Cafe - please improve your hospitality service.

i am only giving this place 4 out of 5 stars bc I have never eaten here.  but, the coffee is THE BEST.  once a weekend, this is my go-to for a large, iced, hazelnut coffee.  it's only about $2.50 and is fantastic.  not to mention the fact that the owner calls me, "sweetheart" every time i go in. HIGHLY recommend.

Really good place to grab a quick bite to eat. Great breakfast menu, and even better lunch menu. Has a really European feel to it, so it you want to hang out there, it feels authentic. Take out is easy -- just order at the counter, take a seat by the door, and you'll be on your way. You even get to pick a side dish (I like the pasta).

I came over here a few months back after attending some workshops over at Moksha for a drink and dinner. Service was friendly and on top of things. I ended up getting a crepe for dessert that was more amazing than what I had thought it would be. Ambience was charming and laid back. Great for groups and solo dining.
I've been there 3 times and I love it. I wish it was near to my house so i'd eat there everyday.

Had a taffy apple crepe and some type of dessert waffle with ice cream and chocolate.  The crepe sucked, and the waffle was forgettable.   On the plus side, this place is open late, the atmosphere is good, and the service was pleasant.

Amazing crepes !! It is my friend's favorite place and she takes all her friends there. Literally everyone !  I loved the crepes and the pastas. They have a good variety of cocktails. Everything is reasonably priced too .. What else can a student ask for ;) !

went here for the first time yesterday morning for coffee- have been back twice since then. great, quick breakfast/coffee option on the way to the blue line. dinner was great- tasty and super reasonable sandwiches. full bar. very cool vibe. I didn't expect it to be so nice inside. great service too! will be back soon, I'm sure.  shared the tuna sandwich and chicken pesto, both were very good! finished with the apple crepes. yum!

I've been here 4 times in the last year and have had consistent experiences. Conceptually it is great. A late night spot that is a cafe and not a bar, though you can order alcohol. No douchebaggery. However, the service is always ridiculously slow. I mean SLOW. This particular night, the waitress was just standing at the counter yawning well after we had finished our food and drinks. We were ready to leave so just went to the counter to pay.  The food is standard, but pretty decent if you're there late in comparison to your other options of greasy Chinese or burgers at 1am.

I would give this place four stars if they only served crepes. Those are awesome here. The appetizers and salads are bland. The crab dip was really "krab" and tasted funny, as artificial crab turns into that weird texture when baked.  What sets this place off from your traditional Greek-owned place is their specialty, the crepes. Definitely have a crepe choice when you visit. Every time I've had crepes here, I've enjoyed them. Varieties range from sweet and fruity, to breakfast crepes, to meat and vegetable filled. The crepes are large and the portions are satisfying.  The deco inside is cozy and chic, and they even have two iguanas to go with the name. The waitstaff always seems to change here, but it's always Eastern European chicks hired as eye candy. In my experience, the management has always been friendly and I will definitely be back. For crepes.
My 7 year old relationship with Iguana Cafe is still going strong !!! Love the crapes........
Cute place! Conversation-friendly & open late with delicious drinks and desserts. What's not to like?
So delicious, really fast service, such a cute little place and great prices! I wish it was closer to home.

I ve been here a couple times already , and i usually love their food and service . Last night i went with a couple of my girlfriends for some hot chai latte and waffles , yet the waitress kept ignoring us , as I tried to order my second drink , I waved for her for a good 20 minutes and rather she didn't see it or she did not want to answer me .  I will still go back there as that is a great place for chatting and they open til 2am  Just please be nice to your customers .....

Super cheap, plenty of decent food, and cool ambiance. Waitress was a little short with us but fine. I would definitely go back, although it's a little far from home for something unremarkable. They have gluten free crepes, which my friend was ecstatic to see, and she said they were good.

Our office recently moved so I am new to the area and was looking for a cafe that served great coffee and food without being crazy expensive. Iguana Cafe far exceeded my expectations. Not only is the coffee great and the food super fresh & yummy (I'm a vegetarian and there's plenty of options!), but the prices are extremely reasonable especially for the area. Best of all, the staff is so friendly and nice- they make you feel like family. One of the managers/baristos Castro learned my name within the first week of me going there! I love places that value community and treat their customers well, and Iguana is definitely one of those places

I'm a fan of Iguana Cafe. They have a nice space and charge reasonable prices for their food and drinks. The portions sizes for their food are on somewhat on the larger side, and the food itself is solid.

I had forgotten about this late night hidden gem until we walked in for a late drink. Drinks were very average but I recall enjoying crepes here back when I was in college - so look forward to returning soon Service was extremely slow with just one person managing all the tables on a Friday night!
Love this place! Crepes are to die for! Service is great. We usually get the carbonara pasta which is delicious and crepes for dessert which, I say again, are to die for!

We had dessert at Iguana Cafe' and we ordered the Iguana special it was an ice coffe with expresso it was great! I love the strong expresso flavor and the sweetness to the ice coffee was perfect. We ordered the banana foster with a little vanilla ice-cream on top it was great. I think it was more of a custard like ice-cream which made it all the more richer and delightful. Service was great, I found the place to be great for a date, group setting and for families as well. I would return here next time for lunch to try their savory dishes.

Dessert time  A random Wednesday night for a late dessert. Iguana Cafe is a great place to socialize. It opens until 12:30AM. We ordered crepe and Bougatsa. Crepe was average. If you like "Nutella", go for it! Bougatsa, this was my first time to try it. It is a Greek Pastry, it consists semolina custard, chess filling between layers of phyllo, and caramel sauce on top. It was great, it had the perfect flaky bite with enough custard, and the sweetness it spot on.

This place rocks. I've been looking for a spot that has excellent crapes and have finally found it. Iguana has a large selection of both sweet and savory crapes as well as salads, sandwiches, wraps and pastas. Also coffees, teas and mixed drinks. Everything is reasonably priced and delicious. Can't wait to go back and also tell everyone about it.

we were there last week - very warm - no AC - windows open.  mid week mid day was busy.  service very laid back so if you want to sit and linger that's no problem.  interior is an odd uninteresting interior of small tables except for the elevated banquette area which still has small rounds but can be pushed together for one long rectangle seating elevated and separated for larger groups.  the menu is heavy crepes and a little of a few other things.  dessert was good - the chocolate cake.  one of us had the creamed soup of the day which we were told was very thick and creamy.  it arrived the consistency of milk and not reminiscent of creamy soup at all.  it was suppose to be broccoli.  it arrived at the table lukewarm to room temperature.  definitely not hot.  since it was so warm inside, when it arrived less than warm in the moment i didn't mind.  however, after eating the soup, one hour later i was in the washroom.  feeling a break for a few minutes i came out and paid the check, and made it home in time for the next round.  not surprising, my system has been recuperating every since.  my advise:  be careful what you order.  as for me, once is enough.

Been to the Iguana a couple times for lunch.  Gotta say, thumbs up.  Quick, cheap and good.  Usually these three don't happen, but it does here.  Easy to get in & get out and take a good cup of coffee with you.  I recommend.

The spicy chicken pepper wrap wasn't spicy and it was pretty soggy. I needed 18 napkins to prevent the sauce and juices from running into my hands down to my elbows.  I couldn't use a fork to eat a wrap, it just would look friggin right so I ate it the classical way.  The wrap is falling apart even though it was on a Panini.   The ventilation for the kitchen odors is poor. I'm in the dining room and I can smell my clothes getting a beat down by the grill and smell from the kitchen. Sure you want to catch some cooking aroma but this is different, it was awful. The place is really nice inside though,  staff is ...The staff!..just there working with no smiles or warmth but I don't mind as I'm not a chatter box. Overall, good. If you're in the area then try it out. It's by no means a destination to brag about.

Yelp's a bit off the mark on this one. The food's just average, along with the service. Incredibly slow.  The crepe I had was pretty good, but it was very difficult to eat thanks to the horrible silverware (cheap, flimsy, not sharp).

This is a great chill place with a very diverse crowd. It's a nice spot to go during the day to do some work, evening with friends, or a first date.  The menu is Mediterranean and I'm partial to the salmon salad and the mango margarita. Oh and yes, there's an actual iguana. :)

Pros: Big portions, food was excellent, and they have an actual iguana in a tank! Cons: Service was okay (can be improved), it was super dark (could barely see my friends), tables are super close together Overall: I think that if the restaurant turned some lights on and moved some tables around, it would be a prime location for a cute date or for hanging out with friends. Food was excellent though! We had a lot to eat. Their dinner crepes were around $8-10 and the dessert crepes were the same. Sandwiches were big and came with chips for about $8. Yum!

Awesome breakfast! They have a giant menu, literally pages long, with everything from sweet and savory crepes, to waffles, to insanely delicious looking fruit salads, and so on. They even have a bar and I noticed an apple mimosa that caught my eye. I fully intend to try it next time.  Yelpers raved about the crepes so I already knew that's what I would be ordering. Good luck deciding which one because they all sound wonderful. I picked one called the Tempting Trio, made with strawberries, bananas, and nutella. It was the size of my head and under $6. I think I was able to eat a quarter of it before calling quits. You can't beat that much delicious for such a small amount. Would be a great place to share food with friends and try a little of everything without breaking the bank.  I also ordered a sugar free vanilla latte that was creamy and fabulous. You would never guess it was sugar free. This is one of the coolest breakfast spots I've been to in the city. The inside is welcoming, and you leave in a high of sugar and caffeine. Is there any better way to start the morning?
Love! Love! Love this place! My favorite sandwich us smoked salmon sandwich... Atmosphere is great for a romantic conversation or a relaxing time with friends.

This place is the best, we're regulars. Coffee, Fredo Cappucino, Chicken Cesar Wrap, and Pesto Chicken Pasta. All of these things are fantastic. And, if you want something affordable, you really can't go wrong. They also take large groups and make reservations. Also, there is an actual iguana in the terrarium, some people think it's a figurine and I did too at first.
Love this place! Super Euro, great coffee, good service. Went there every day while on vacation in Chicago. Good crepes, the coffee is the draw.

The bakery here is wonderful. My favorite is their crapes, absolutely to die for. Their espresso drinks are VERY strong, which is what I prefer, but be careful if you are not use to caffeine, their stuff packs a kick.

Iguana Cafe is a great place to go for a lot of different reasons. It has quick access to public transportation (blue line and bus) and the parking is very easy to find along Halsted.  Their menu has lots of different options, their wraps, salads, pastas, and crepes are delicious! Their dessert crepes are so amazing they have wide of variety of different crepes to choose from savory and sweet. Their coffee drinks are good too, they can make lots of different drinks even if they are not on the menu. I have never tried their baked goods such as their cookies, brownies, etc. but their dessert crepes are by far my favorite. My one girlfriend loves to order their savory crepes for her meals all the time when we go there. I've only ever heard great things about their chicken pesto pasta as well.  I have never ordered alcohol from this place, but I do know that they serve it. The waitresses are very kind and attentive to their tables that they are serving. Usually around lunch time there is not too long of a wait if you are in a hurry and they do not take much time to take your order and have your food brought out to you.

I almost didn't want to write this review because I don't want any one else to know about my little secret cafe! Iguana Cafe is really great. It is a small, intimate environment, with a killer menu and friendly employees. I've had many things on the menu, including sanwhiches, wraps, pasta dishes, deserts & crepes, & coffee! This is my favorite go-to stop! It is perfect for after dinners or a movie, especially because it is open late on the weekends! The workers don't mind if you are sitting there for hours with a coffee, or keep ordering deserts! They don't push you out like other cafes if you are trying to relax and have a conversation with friends. This is a great location, not too busy, and with parking easily available. GO TO IT!!!!

This place is amazing from the moment you walk in! The staff is super friendly, the people there are all very well dressed and it gives a great atmosphere. I ordered the crepe, it was to die for. It had bananas, strawberries, cinnamon, honey, and walnuts. The perfect combo. I recommend this place to anyone.

I live in the 'hood so this is my go to place when I want to grab something "restauranty", but don't want to travel far. My friends and I threw a bridal shower here and the owner was really great in accomodating our budget and dietary needs. We ended up having 2 passed appetizers, sandwiches with sides and an awesome cake, plus coffee, tea and soda for about 12 girls at lunchtime for really cheap! We were also allowed to come in early and decorate the back area and the best part was that the restaurant cleaned up the mess for us.  I really like this place and have never had bad food here. The only downside is the European concept where service can be a little slow, but I wouldn't recommend this place if you're in a hurry. It's nice to be able to sit and enjoy the place with friends over fancy coffees and drinks without being rushed to leave.

Sunday night, after standing by the "Please Wait To Be Seated" post for 15 minutes ignored, I decided to walk away. After 5 minutes of waiting in the restaurant, I started to take glances at the staff which eventually had to result in long, awkward stares. It was apparent they didn't get the clue that they should at least say something. How about something as simple or casual as "Sorry, we'll get you a seat as fast as we can get one" or making a commonly used wait list.  It seems like they lacked a hostess, a manager, a second wait staff and a couple of busers.  I attribute this lack of restaurant sensibility to be the fault of the manager and owner. Can the entire front of the house be run with a quiet bartender and a quiet waitress who only see their job as quietly minding the task immediately in front of them? No that's just a cheap solution that cuts down payroll and lack of training.  If you expect restaurants to understand customer sensibility, don't expect to find that here. If the manager or owner does not care to be there, it's also a bad sign.

Late night coffee stop with the Bae. We were out driving around looking for a quiet place to chat. I love this place. Great lattes, muffins and waffles. This is my second time here just didn't think about yelping about it until now!

Food was delicious! Went there on a Thursday night with two other friends, so we were able to try three different entrees. All three of them were so good and reasonably priced. The dinner crepe (I had the Amsterdam) was my favorite. I also really like the Ionion Wrap.  I ordered a virgin bloody mary but it was far too spicy for my taste, so I exchanged it for a  martini at no additional cost.  The only reason I'm giving it four stars instead of five is because I thought the service was rushed. It seemed like only one woman was waiting the tables. Also, there is no private lot, but we didn't have trouble finding street parking.

Absolutely love this place!! My fave go-to spot. Reasonably priced. Timely food. Cool ambience (low-lit, artwork, sims music.) OPEN LATE! Never a time I don't come in w/o ordering their bruschetta, chicken cesar wrap & brownie a la mode. Thank you iguana! -your faithful local  patron

GO GET THEIR CREPE OH MY WORD IT IS SO BIG! AND SO GOOD. so worth it! ive never had one better than the one here its just so perfect. AND BEAUTIFUL. i also tried their waffle, which is not bad either and green tea is okay their sandwiches are ehh okay but that CREPE MANNNNN THAT CREPPEEE! service-wise theyre not that friendly maybe they dont think college kids would tip well

I have been coming here for over 4 years, and I always have a great experience! this place is well deserving of 5 Stars! Great Ambiance! Great Food! Good Service!  AWESOME PRICES!! This is the only place in Chicago that actually makes me feel like im in Greece! the open windows in the summer and the cozy feeling in the winter makes Iguanna café always warm and inviting. I love that you can see people playing backgammon and hear them speaking their language, its pretty European! hence "European Coffee House" Good for a quick meal, intimate enough for a nice date with the old lady, or when im entertaining people from out of town. I can usually order without opening the menu. I like the Freddo Cappucino, cheesy crab dip, chicken pesto sandwich or carbonara pasta and always a Chocolate Delight Crepe (I add a little bit of peanut butter) BEST CREPES IN CHICAGO!!!  I highly recommend it. I will be back soon and often! Keep it up!
This place is awesome any time of the day or night. The best crepes you will EVER find in the US.  Atmosphere is so intimate at night but great for lunching with friends during the day.
Love this place, awesome 'build your own' sandwiches. Good pastas, salads and cafe beverages. Consistent and tasty, perfect for lunch or dinner. Great prices and great service.

This place is always great!  The menu is extensive - tons of sweet and savory crepes, waffles, sandwiches, and about a bazillion coffee, tea, and cocktail options.  Service is always good and so is the food.  This is our standard late night crepe/dessert/coffee place in the area, just fabulous!
My favorite spot! Everything on their menu is amazing. Crepes, sandwiches, pasta, THE COFFEE. Love this place.

As a college student under budget, this is definitely a place to go for delicious crepes! After coming back from studying abroad, I was craving for crepes and pasta carbonara and found this place.  All dishes are under $10 and served in huge portion. People study there, but I see it as more of a dining place rather than a study cafe. I'd say it can be a cute little date place. Love restaurants that aren't crowded and have great food. One of my favorite restaurants. A year later, as of July 2015, this is still my favorite restaurant, just have to double check that I wrote a review for this place ha.

I had high hopes walking in here. Beautiful decor and ambiance but all the good stopped there. It took 10 minutes for someone to come to our table. The waitress was extremely rude and wouldn't answer our questions, the crepe a were way overstuffed and the wine had oxidized. Then to top it off we had to chase someone down to get our bill at the end. I won't be back.

My boyfriend and I came here for the first time for after dinner desert and tea. I LOVED this place! I have been looking for a chill cafe/ restaurant open late night in this part of the city, and I have definitely found my place. We split the berry crepe (strawberries, bananas and nutella) and it was incredible, huge portion, and only $5.95!! We also both got some tea. Looking forward to coming back to this place to try the entrees and cocktails. The atmosphere is great- I really loved the little fountain right when you walk in! Our waitress seemed a little aloof at times, but it was a great experience nonetheless.

Great atmosphere, nice service, disappointing food. I was very confused when I ordered a prosciutto and Gouda sandwich on a French baguette and got toasted sesame bread with regular ham and some kind of overly cooked cheese- not what I ordered nor expected. Maybe their other food is good but I was surprised by the good reviews, does no one know what a European sandwich is like? I ate it anyways, but won't come back.

My favorite local go-to spot. Amazing crepes, sandwiches, desserts, you name it. Everything I've had here is amazing, and such a good value. One of the best-priced places in town.  The service can be a little spotty at times, and it can get pretty packed and, in true European cafe fashion, the tables and seating arrangements are pretty compact. However, very cute decor, easy to get to (grand blue line or pretty good parking options).  It's the only place we're willing to truck out in the snow for!

I have to update and say the custard...Ohhhh the custard!! It changed my life! Don't get dessert anywhere else! I'm telling you.  We're on our way there now for dinner and dessert and couldn't be more excited :) I'm looking forward to tasting the actual entrees.

This little jewel never disappoints.  The lattes here are fantastic... rich and velvety!  The food is awesome... we've tried their dessert crepes, which are my favorite (and less expensive than a plain crepe at the farmer's market), Belgian waffles, breakfast sandwiches and their chicken pesto pasta... outstanding!  Our usual server, Kosta, is excellent!  He even remembered my husband mentioning that we were coming back for my birthday in a few days and brought out my awesome crepe with a lighted candle!  How cool is that??!!  Service is a HUGE part of any dining experience and this place is on top of it.  They bring water for us (even a kid's cup for my 3-year-old) right when we are seated, which is nice.  Food is A+.  Service is A+.  Ambiance is A+.  Value is A+.  This knows its business well!

Lox on a bagel is very good here, and the most reasonably priced in town. The service can be spotty at times if they're busy, but I have been there multiple times and never hesitate to go back. They have a mix of coffee, a full bar, light dishes, and heavy meals...so it's pretty much all good!

I love this place. The crepes are really awesome. the ambience is very chill and euro ... I highly recommend this as a nice date spot and also a place you can get work done with quality drinks, sandwiches, sweets etc... parking can be difficult at times... the last time I went wifi was not free....  I recommend the nutella crepes with strawberry and bananas

The crepes are amaze-balls.  AND affordable!  The cafe is also very cute - reminds me of a cute little European cafe.  FYI  -  If you are getting the dessert crepes to go, I would recommend you ask for the nutella, fruit, etc.  all separate.  Thankfully they are very accommodating, so they will do as you ask.

If this neighborhood cafe we're going swimming it'd definitely wear a speedo. From the crepes and coffee to the ambiance and atmosphere it certainly has a sensation of a European spot.  It's kind of a cross between a sit down restaurant and a coffee shop. There's free wifi and the menu is very cafe-like, but you don't seat yourself and you have an assigned server so I'm not sure how cool it is to post up for an entire day with your laptop.  Regardless of whether I overstayed my welcome or not the service was great filling up my water five minutes and being super friendly. The food was awesome and affordable, but I wasn't thrilled on the coffee which is the only reason I wouldn't give them 5 stars.  If you're in the area I'd definitely give them a try.
Great crepes! However the customer service is awful-I was just there and we had a waitress with bright red hair who completely ignored us, threw the check at us and never even said thank you.

Great crepes!  Slow service. Overall a nice place though. There's a weird iguana cage near the ceiling. Can't put my finger on the vibe, but it is barish, coffee houseish, and resturantish. Food was very good!  Great price.

What a great find!  We stayed in the loop and attended a conference up near Goose Island and went looking for a good lunch before leaving the city.  We Yelp-ed to iguana Cafe and we're glad we did! The name doesn't seem to align with savory crepe meals a la Brittany, but wonderful crepes we found.  We started with a couple appetizers including the "Tirokafteri" (spicy feta cheese spread) and loved them.  We tried several crepes--all very good, but must recommend both the "Prague" and the "Sparta."   Salads were fresh and meal portions were large.  We ran out of time or we would have had the "Chocolate Monkey" dessert crepe (Nutella and banana, a la Paris).  Leave 'em wanting more, I guess! The prices were so reasonable and the ambiance nice.  We can't wait to return.

Cozy find by grand and milwaukee (blue line stop). Attentive service, unique decor and along the lines of what others are saying- has a european style to it- where you can have a tasty meal an relax with friends or your morning coffee without being bumped around by servers or other patrons. Only stopped in a coffee but saw some of the food they brought out for others and it looked like they enjoyed it. Will come back to try again!

Perfect for a relaxing evening with friends, a working lunch, or quick breakfast to go. I've been going here for ten years, the prices and food quality have stayed the same, regardless of big renovations. I miss the fountain that used to exist with the pond, back in the day when the iguanas were also more visible but the most recent renovations have made the layout fit more tables.

We love this cafe. Love it!!! Although it's around the block from where we live I would pass it all the time and at first thought it was too convenient. My lifelong friend had us meet her there for some food and what turned out to be the BEST coffee. The crepes are incredible and the scene is out of this world and unique. It's truly a European cafe in west town. If you looking for a place to chill or enjoy great food, you will feel so lucky to find this gem.

I wondered what the name "Iguana" means, especially in a "European" cafe. Kosta explained that the owner had a restaurant in Greece with same name. This is then a little Greek refuge on a busy intersection (Milwaukee, Grand and Halsted) that welcomes the thirsty and hungry visitor. You can feel at home here in a wifi atmosphere with a very friendly waitstaff and artistic decor. It's a  favorite oasis of mine away from the maddening rush of the urban jungle-aye there's that beckoning lizard. He/she is waiting for you at 517 N. Halsted.

This place reminds me of a place called The Globe in Prague.  It's dark but inviting and cozy.  You are just as likely to find someone sipping coffee on their laptop as some women having a wine dinner.  I was expecting European style service after reading reviews but I got American style.  Nothing awesome but actually not bad at all, but our server was from Bulgaria.  The wine list is not great but most are $6 so very inexpensive.  My only gripe here is perhaps putting some higher end wines on the menu for those who want them but overall no complaints.  We started with the cheesy crab dip and I loved it.  The bread and pitas are awesome as well.  I got the Prague crepe with onion.  I agree with everyone that they are massive.  I would prefer European portions as opposed to huge American portions but if you cut it in half or two thirds and just plan on taking half of it home for breakfast the next day, you're fine.  I read a review where someone said the crepes were pita like.  I'm not sure if the restaurant figured that out and changed their recepe but mine were nice crepes.  They were not skimpy on the filling either.  My only complaint was the size and it wasn't like the food blew me away.  My two companions got make your own sandwiches.  This was the funny part.  They have little PDA things where they take the order.  She repeated all of the toppings.   However when they came, half the toppings that were supposed to be on one were on the other and vice versa.  It wasn't even like one or two things...the entire orders were just completely mixed.  Since both happened to like what ended up on their sandwich, it was more funny than anything else so we didn't say anything.  I don't think it was the server but likely the kitchen that messed that up but very strange.  Perhaps the server figured out the order goof or she remembered my friend who has been in there several times since he lives close but she gave us a dessert waffle on the house.  The waffle itself was awesome.  Very crisp outside and fluffy and moist inside.  There was chocolate, Nutella, and honey drizzled and some vanilla ice cream on top.  Yummy!  Overall the ambiance is a 5, service a 3, and food a 3.5 so I'm settling on 4.  If there is another spot in Chicago like this, I haven't found it yet so bonus for filling a niche that is missing.

My boyfriend turned me on to this place as a late night go-to (think 11 PM, midnightesque, any day of the week) when we wanted a nice, charming place with a full menu, easy seating, and a nice, chill crowd. Their menu is huge, with sandwiches, pastas, crepes, desserts, everything.  They offer a ton of build-your-own options so if you can't find it, you can make it.  Their pasta dishes are huge and their chicken pesto pasta is my fave (workout days only, that shit is rich).  Oh, and for a a non-coffee person, I can't leave this place without ordering an Iguana Special, their version of a frappuccino.  I dig this place so much I had my office bday lunch here, and they let me make a reservation for 15, no prob.  The tables were ready when we got there and our waiter handled it like a pro.  I love that this place is all about the options - it's great for singles, couples, and groups, whether it's lunch, dinner, or late night.  So ya, this is def a must try. Note:  Service here can be a bit... slow.  If you're in a rush to leave, feel free to walk up to the register, tell them what you ordered and pay there.

Yum! Picked up a simple spinach salad with strawberries, walnuts and feta cheese. added chicken and balsamic vinaigrette. Very good! Big portion, with lots of chicken and spinach and the other ingredients for $8.31. Only negative side is that I honestly cannot finish the whole thing. Came with toasted bread, but I didn't eat any.

I love this place. Always chill, always good prices, always wonderful food. I've been about 4 times, bringing different friends each time, and it has been nice every visit. Savory crepes and pasta dishes are the tastiest here. Also, they are amazing about multiple credit cards, which is incredibly rare!

Cute european vibe. Perfect setting for an intimate meal, catching up with a friend over coffee or enjoying crepes with a group.  The service is very nice and the place is very cozy.  The dim lighting makes you feel like you have entered a very secluded private setting to escape all your troubles and just enjoy the food. They don't rush you here and it's a great feeling to know that you can sit and enjoy your meal and company without feeling pressured to leave for the next guest to take your seat.
I LOVE THIS PLACE!! I never had a bad experience. If you like crepes, this is your place! They can custom make whatever you want..

Still great. The chicken pesto pasta dish is the best in town. The spicy chicken wrap-- still amazing. The lattes- great. The cookie and ice cream dessert crepe---FANTASTIC! A must get. Great service, every time.

this is my neighborhood cafe and i love everything about it. they serve awesome, wholesome, healthy sandwiches all under or around $7. i always feel so good after i eat here and chat it up with a friend or get some work done. it's nice and open and everyone that works here is very nice and attentive. i could honestly spend an entire day here. the lox and cream cheese is only $4.50 and they serve brilliant coffee. my friend i come here frequently for a nightcap or to just catch up on our daily lives. you always see cute couples on their first dates and such so i guess this place makes a great date spot too. :)

Service was great, atmosphere was comfortable and relaxing, and the food was delicious. My 3 friends and I each ordered a pasta dish- 2 chicken pesto and 2 napolitans. Overall a good meal with great taste and portions! I'll be back sometime on Friday or Saturday for late night coffee and dessert. :)

Several of us came here to celebrate the last part of my friend's bachelorette party. It is a nice place to hangout at night with your friends to catch up, grab a drink or two, and chat. Music playing in the background, and  you can order food as well along with other drinks. We stayed here til 2am (when they closed). Good place to hangout on a Saturday night if you're still hungry or thirsty. It's a very chill environment.

my friends and I went here last night for dinner. we were a big group with lots of visitors to the city. the restaurant was nearly empty when we came in save for another group of maybe 8 or 10 and two small parties of two or three. of course it's stressful to have a large group of folks come in at once sitting at multiple tables, so I'm writing this knowing that we probably surprised them and it affected their attitudes and ability to treat us with respect. the good part is the food was really delicious.I had one of their baked pasta bowls (not the  famous crepes  which also were good)  and I couldn't eat it fast enough. I  also tried their hummus which was decent,  but came with plenty to share.   the bad part is that  the  service was terrible. our  waitress was incredibly rude and short to the point that none if us wanted to tip her. of course she added in her  mandatory  gratuity.  (why be courteous if you know your tip already is included seems to be the assumption under which she was working) There is apparently, a $3  charge for sitting and not ordering (ostensibly  because you take up the space a paying  patron could have used,  but since we took up most of the restaurant,  you would  think  they'd give us a break on  the 2  people  out of 30 who didn't order food.  incidentally, they refused to order food because they find the waitress  so disagreeable).     before we ordered we asked about how to pay. when we took the bill to the bar,  the  manager told us to use the ATM  because running three cards at our 8-top was going to be too  difficult. we refused  because the waitress  told us we could use as many cards as  we  wanted. his  answer: " well, you're going to have to wait."   I'm sure they were stressed out about having a full restaurant, but I'm thinking, given the great reviews the place has  gotten, they've had a full house before. the service was atrocious.  the food may have been great, but I don't know if I'll ever suggest  out of towners  to  come here again. they  came off with a  bad  impression of the city after eating (or not eating) here.

I can't say enough good things about this awesome local spot. Service is good, food is simple but very good & never disappoints. Everything here is always consistent. Such a sexy/cozy atmosphere and you can't beat the prices.  I've been going here for three years and finally just realized I should write a review. Love it!

4-Stars for decent food and drinks at GREAT prices (for being in Chicago!).  Located conveniently off of the Blue Line's Grand/Milwaukee el stop (a big plus for us people using public transit). I've been here a few times  at night with friends who absolutely love their cosmopolitans.  We are all a big fan of their crêpes!  In my latest visit, I ordered their salmon salad.  It was delicious, big, and packed with ingredients!   The vibe of this place is interesting.  The lighting is dark, and reminiscent of a chic European lounge.  A lot of people stay for hours, chatting over drinks and appetizers to snack on.  However, there are sports games playing on a couple TVs, so you will have a few bros come in to watch games and cheer for their team.  Then again, it is also a café, so even late at night, there are people here with books, reading with a cup of coffee at their table.  I wouldn't recommend this place for a first date or families with kids, but overall it's a pretty cool place to go!

I come here nearly every weekend for a coffee drink.  The service is great and I've rarely had to wait for anything.  There is a real Iguana inside too which is pretty awesome.  I recommend the Chi Tea latte and rasberry lemonade.

I found the place through Yelp because I was craving for crepes! Oh boy! The place is amazing because i love how the place is not cheap with the ingredients!  The chocolate delight and waffles were amazing! The pasta dish was excellent too. My bf and I already went back to the place twice. We will go back to it again!
First time I've ever tried a crepe in US! Like it, the savory crepe is really good.

This is one of my favorite places to go in Chicago. I usually go with larger groups and we just walk in and they are always very accommodating. I love the whole vibe of the place. The food is great and it's not even that expensive!

THE CREPE FROM THIS PLACE IS TO DIE FOR!! LOVEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE their crepe.  I came here once with a friend. She ordered spicy chicken wrap. IT WAS BIG (for a girl!!). I tasted it and yummmm, it was yummy. My order was amsterdam crepe and raspberry mocha latte. It was a veggie crepe. Moist and yummy, that's all I can say. The latte was yummmmmm.  Ok so I used a lot of YUMMMM words, but I'm sure that you'll say the same when you go to this place. The price is just right in your pocket and the decor is just cozy. A great place when I need to escape from the kids. Lol.

My favorite cafe for over a decade! I know their menu by heart and I still go back, all the time. Even the 30 minute drive won't keep me away. Why, you wonder? Well, here is why: Chicken ceasar wrap, greek sandwich, Nutella crepe, coffee, the atmosphere, the art... Oh, their wine selection is pretty good, too! The best part? Their prices are oh so reasonable, especially considering their location. This is a must-visit!

A charming, Euro coffeehouse and crepe cafe. So adorable and eclectic. Crepes, paninis and omelets line the menu along with coffee, hot chocolate and tea. The main dishes are not phenomenal, but, the dessert is divine. Not a foodie must, but,, a great place to hangout, work or catch up. You will find a fabulous mix of people sitting at their tables from morning till late in the evening. Wifi access is available and they will not rush you out. You can type away on your laptop for hours while enjoying their easy, inexpensive cuisine.

Just when I was giving up hope on finding a true "cafe" in River North, I stumbled upon Iguana Cafe. It may technically be just outside the River North boundary but is only a ~15min walk from most of River North.  Iguana Cafe is a great place to go to at anytime of the day or night (it's open late) and enjoy a coffee, meal or drink without it costing you a fortune or having to deal with a pretentious River North establishment. The atmosphere does feel European and it is probably something to do with some of the European (I think) staff and concept of a cafe in general. The service is prompt and staff is very friendly. Parking is easy to find if you choose to drive and the Blue Line el stop is a minute away. The menu is varied and includes items ranging from great crepes (savory as well as dessert), sandwiches, pasta, meat and cheese plates along with plenty of beverage options from coffees, teas, wines and a full bar.  My favorites are the Chocolate Monkey (crepe with nutella, banana and vanilla ice cream), Pikilia (assortment of cheeses, meats, breads and spreads) and some of the savory crepes. I havent had a chance to try the sandwiches and pastas, but I've heard good things about them.
The most amazing service, food, prices and atmosphere in the area. I am unable to find any reason to rate less than 5 stars. And I'm usually not this generous with my stars.

OMG I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!  the have the best crepe in town!!! i would recommend the delicious Amsterdam crepe, the banana and chocolate crepe but my favorite is build your own crepe.  I load my crepe with tons of veggies and cheese and it comes out to about $8.  definitely try the olive cheese spread in your crepe...you wont regret it.  the ambiance is great too!! has a rainforest kind of decor but with a european menu.  they also have chess and checkers which you can borrow and play.  we enjoyed our crepes and a couple of games of chess.  they also have beer and wine!! I ve gone about 3 times in the last 2 weeks.  wish this place was closer, but i definitely dont mind the drive there!

I love this place, especially because it's open late. I always get the crepes, nothing fancy, but simple enough to satisfy my sweet tooth. Even though it's usually late when I come here, I always get the cafe mocha, which is very good and comes in a huge mug. Street parking at this time of the day is available, although you may have to drive around a little. The service is always great and the space is nice and intimate.
Pros: Great prices, awesome coffee, lattes, and desserts. Cons: service can be a bit slow.  Would come here again.

Savory crepes. Dessert waffles. Freddo cappuccino. These are the items that keep me coming back. It's safe to say that I've tasted most items from the menu at Iguana but there are my go-to favorites. Great European café atmosphere.
kind of a cool place but with slow unfriendly service. only had dessert crepes and coffe which was just ok. menu looks good though

The food was great. The waiter was really nice. But the food took an hour and a half to make it to the table. My family and I ordered 4 crepes and we waited, patiently. While the food was good, i didn't expect to spend my day waiting. Hire new cooks who own a watch!

I have been frequenting this cafe for the past 8 years and it remains my favorite in the world. Iguana has European style service, atmosphere, food, and beverages with outstanding coffees and crepes. The staff are friendly and food is fast and delicious. It is also a great place to have a cocktail or beverage of choice and enjoy the atmosphere. The music is perfect and surroundings are cozy in the winter and open air in the summer.
A nice place for having dessert.. We ordered brownies wih ice cream. It was delicious

Great selection! I like the food options and ambience here, plus parking is easy. They keep to a unique trend of middle eastern and/or generally European style food.  I did happen to try the Baked Goat Cheese and the Vegetarian wrap, as well as the Tirokafeteri. Anyone who enjoys that style of food (easily categorized as greek/middle eastern) will be at home here. They also have some unique drinks to choose from, including a variation on an Irish Coffee. Meanwhile, service was polite and the place has a unique layout.   There's also something to be said about the fact that they have some bar-food on the table as appetizers (some weird nut-mix kinda like a chex mix).  I think I will be coming back here sometime if I'm in the area, as this was a decent (if not terse) meal. However, a review this short tells me that it's simply not "memorable" as much as "Acceptable".

Went with a couple for friends for late night dessert and drinks.  Love the specialty coffee drinks.  We tried 2 dessert crepes and 1 savory crepe (Lisbon), all were tasty and the portions were big. We especially loved the atmosphere, it was busy, music very pleasant but not too loud, were were able to enjoy our conversation.  Parking was easy.  Over all a great value and a good time.  Will definitely return soon.

Iguana Cafe is amazing. My boyfriend and I come here all the time. I'm from London and he's from Frankfurt and it reminds us of the cafes in Europe. Very nice reminder of home in the middle of Chicago. Their crepes are amazing. Actually, everything is amazing. Parking is also good, we always find a spot.

This place is located in a bit of an odd spot on Halsted close to what's more of a bar scene.  Found this years ago.... cool hip coffee joint that has solid food.  I like their egg and bacon croissant in the morning.  The espresso drinks are solid, sometimes a bit too sweet for my taste depending on who makes it but overall I'm satisfied.  The place is good for both "to go" and sitting down for drinks on a weekend morning.  The place actually has a pretty big night life showing and serves wine in the evenings.  Reminds me of a coffee joint I hit when in Santiago years back.  Staff is pleasant and helpful.  wireless is a bit sketchy at times.  If you are at this end of town it's a goto place for coffee as the only other location worth visiting near it is Sip.

food: wonderful! savory and sweet crepes are delicious!  atmosphere: you feel like you're sitting in an intimate and inviting little european coffeeshop that is open an extended amount of hours and somehow transcends from morning to afternoon to late evenings fliudly!  prices: this is almost the best part....everything is almost more than reasonable! i've taken several friends and family here after i went here on a date once. it's perfect for any date or small gathering. the cafe isn't huge, so don't show up with 10 friends, come with 1 - 3 people and have a good heart and soul conversation.

A European cafe with a nice selection of food and drinks. Go there any time of day and try one of their appetizers, or if you're hungry get a sandwich - Chicken Pesto with Pasta Salad is a favorite of mine. I'm a tea person, so I did have a regular breakfast tea; the Chai Latte, while not the best I've had, is still delicious since its served with a nice sprinkling of cinnamon powder. I love that the staff is friendly and do not hurry you! Sit with a book, or your laptop, work or just lounge about. They will still give you their best and you will enjoy the peace and quiet. This might just become my weekend haunt!
Mmmmm...waffles. Coffee wasn't too bad, but no refills? Come on.
This place is my guilty pleasure, the pasta dishes are to die for! Mmm-mm!
service from the younger guy that worked there was terrible. I'll give it 2 stars though cause they serve beer. Whatever, won't go back.
You pay for refills.  Yep, a fountain diet coke costs $2.50 and a refill costs $2.50.  $5.00 for 12 oz....ridiculous.
Euro style all the way! I love this place...great for late night gatherings! My fave is the Mediterranean feast and the banana/strawberry/carmel crepe.  BIG FAN!!!!
One of the best cafe experiences you're gonna get. Great coffee, food, atmosphere, prices. You will never know what crepes are until you go to Iguana Cafe. When you try em, you'll be hooked.

I keep coming back! They have the most divine Belgian waffles.  I really suggest the 'European Dream': Nutella, honey, chocolate syrup, and a scoop of vanilla ice cream for all you sweet tooths. There is also a wide selection of crepes and other joys.  Very decent prices, and open till 2AM on Fridays and Saturdays. I've gone there numerous times with friends on a whim, had a birthday party there, and I'm never waiting long for open seats. Great staff and a full bar. I couldn't ask for more.

Iguana Café is a sexy little European bistro with a lizard in the wall. What else do you need?  -1 star for no free wifi. Decent Coffee drinks (no cappuccino art). Very yummy food like crepes and hummus plates.

I don't know what it is, but I've only had breakfast on here as a call ahead pick-up order or walk-in pick-up.  They are super fast and friendly, which is amazing because I'm such a grump in the mornings that others' bubbly attitudes get me going more than coffee in the morning! There's a huge aquarium with an Iguana in it, which is pretty sweet and overall the cafe is very aesthetically pleasing.   Now, I've only ordered Egg & Cheese Bagel Sandwiches, so maybe I'm a little biased, but I've never had a better egg and cheese bagel anywhere in the city... and the strangest part about that is that they aren't that difficult to make.  Hmmmm.  Nom!

There's an iguana cage in the wall like 20 feet off the ground.  So apparently the name is not just a clever name!  I didn't see the iguana though.  I guess that alone is reason enough to go back. The sandwiches are great and I felt like the menu was very attractively priced.  Really liked the caramel delight crepe (might be forgetting the correct name)

I met my friend here for lunch. We both ordered crepes and I ordered a coffee to go. The crepes came out really quickly. I got the Amsterdam crepe which was stuffed with a lot of tomatoes and peppers. The coffee was a nice mid day pick me up.  It's a cute little place and I would definitely come back to try another of their crepes.

My boyfriend and I love this place.  The servers are great, nice place and they always seem to find a table for us.  I forgot to ask for a shot of espresso that I get in me tea and the server asked to make sure I didn't want it! Good memory, good customer service.  Lots of vegetarian options.

Folks it doesn't get better than this little european cafe gem west of downtown! I frequent this place often and have tried most of the items on the menu and all are delicious and generously portioned. The raspberry mocha is my routine drink here and I love all the wraps on the menu they are so awesome! The service is great and the atmosphere is very warm, and laid back with cool music and a really chill feel all around during the day. OH and if you're wanting to just a tad spike of spice in your coffee you can make any drink extra warm and cozy going down. At night it transforms into sort of a little euro downtempo type club/cafe with dim lighting and trendy kids sipping wine or espresso. I come here often to do screenwriting or read and I just simply cant speak highly enough for this cafe.

I disliked my meal here. Really, really disliked it. I got the Greek sandwich (feta, grilled zucchini, cucumbers, and tomatoes), and it was just gross. The bread was hard and tasteless, the zucchini tasted.... strange, the spices seemed off, and the tomatoes were of such poor quality that they should not have been served.  A friend told me this place was good for brunch, but I have to disagree. Their brunch menu is limited, and those who choose not to eat sweets for breakfast (they emphasize chocolately crapes) will be disappointed. Also, the loud, generic techno music wasn't very brunch-friendly at all.

LOVE THIS PLACE. They have amazing food, especially crepes. Only problem is sometimes waitress can ignore you if it is crowded and bring the dishes one by one for the same table so we need to start eating at different times but if you warned them before they make it right.

A friend and I had a very nice dinner here.  The service was friendly but not pushy, and the ambiance was extremely pleasant.  The menu's extensive, maybe too extensive for comfort.  Neither of us had any trouble ordering, and as a vegetarian, I really appreciated the large number of meatless options.  We both had specialty crepes, and they were quite tasty and sizable.  One crepe is plenty for a filling dinner here, but, nonetheless, we decided to split a dessert crepe as well, which was terrific.  The place is cheap: dinner for the two of us, counting dessert, was just over $20.  However, neither of us ordered drinks, so I can't comment on the bar options other than to say they looked impressive.

I really like it! I went here with a friend of mine for lunch, and I loved everything about the place... from the menu, to the atmosphere, to the food.. I had the Mediterranean sandwich, and it was delicious! I wish I had consulted yelp before going, I saw here that they have grapefruit juice and I am someone who really enjoys grapefruit juice! lol.  I had a stella with my food and my friend had a cup of tea. Tab was about $11 , not bad at all for lunch with a beer :)  Going back for more, for sure!

Terrific pasta dishes, (seriously. . . ) and unique grilled wraps.  One of my favorite post 7am coffee stops in the morning.  Dessert options? Simply amazing - any crepe or waffle you select here comes with ice cream and chocolate.  Overall the best nightcap, (for a sweet-tooth) that you'll find in Chicago.

I want to like you I really do! It was awhile ago since I've been here so I can't be as detailed as I would like to. I've been here several times, but I never really had a good experience here. The last time I came in for a quick crepe snack and wanted to relax with a cup of chai latte. The crepe was overly sweet, and the chai latte wasn't even a latte!  Hopefully my friends don't drag me back here!

Breakfast crepes are great but I definitely recommend a late-night Nutella Banana crepe. Cold Nescafe Frappe is always refreshing; Ask for a shot of Bailys in your frappe at night, definitely hits the stop. Cool music and a laid back Euro vibe keeps me coming back. My only complaint is I wish they had free wi-fi.   Breakfast, lunch and dinner menu is good, but late-night desserts & coffee are where Iguana shines. Service is generally very good, Overall best coffeehouse in Chicago.

I go there with my friends all the time. Stuff is always smiling and friendly. Prices are very reasonable. I like their smoked salmon salad a lot !!! their menu is great.  But what I like the most -  it reminds me little bit of Europe. Where else in Chicago you can get that feeling!!! Try it and you will see what I'm talking about!!

The reviews were always top. The recommendations were plentiful. The applause went up high. I didn't quite get it. On entry, it feels as though you're going into an independent coffee house. Do I seat myself? Do I wait to be seated? What's my cue? I got a seat courtesy the hostess who seemed scrambled and then I sat. And sat. And sat. Once I pulled out my high-end camera, as I planned to blog the restaurant, there was immediate service. So, that was what it took. Can you say extensive menu, boys and girls? So very American, not European, says the Brit in me. The iced chai was refreshing, although I somehow think it was from a carton and accented with cinnamon. The Belgian waffle was enough to plaster a smile across my face. And the Greek yoghurt with strawberries and bananas made me nod. Good food and cute ambience aside, I had to beckon for the tab several times. Even after I had given the payment, via credit card, there was a bit of a wait until it was rung. Well, I can now say that I have been to Iguana Cafe, almost like saying I've read "Fifty Shades of Grey" because I don't want to be left out of conversation.

I arranged to meet a dozen friends here last night because we thought this would be a cool spot to gather.  Since the place was empty when we walked in, you would have thought the management would be appreciative of the business.  Not so.  We got an earful about how we should have made a reservation ..... and by the way if our group grows any larger we won't be able to seat you even near one another because we want the place to be spread out.   The food was terrific, the attitude sucked.  They got a little nicer as we spent more money.... but the attitude was just a little odd.  It was as though we interrupted their quiet evening and they did not appreciate serving a larger group in an otherwise empty restaurant.  If they could just tweak the customer service to be more welcoming that would be great.   Oh .... and don't get me started on the fee-based wifi service.  90% of Chicago places with internet provide the service for free to encourage customers to visit, linger and make purchases.  Somebody here should get the hint and drop the paid access plan!

Love the crepes here. I recommend the Chocolate Monkey (Nutella, Banana, topped with vanilla ice cream) and the Delectably Fruity (Strawberry, banana and powdered sugar). Environment is dim and moderately loud. The ambiance is trendy, and a little laid-back, definitely not pretentious, intimate but not cramped. They also open late which is never bad in my book.  I would definitely hit up this place more often if I lived closer to Chicago. This place is ideal for groups up to 6, given their tables are all quite small. Based on the two crepes I shared with friends, I pretty much want to come back enough times to try everything on the menu. Good work Iguana Cafe. Good work. Cheers.

I want to love this place, but it's just okay. On the plus side, friendly staff, gets to-go orders fulfilled and out the door quickly, and great frappe. Downside, their savory crepes just aren't that good. I love crepes and I continue to go back because this place is close to home, but the ingredients inside the crepe never taste very fresh (everything has  from the jar flavor). The crepe cook also does not wear gloves and as a vegetarian, I don't want meat handled and then my veggie crepe. I'll continue to go back for the freppe, but probably start skipping the savory crepes.
The best little cafe in the city... awesome sandwiches great ambiance... the best food for a great price. I eat there way too much ;)

Open till 2 am on weekends?  NICE!  Where are you going to go grab a bite to eat at 1am that's not a diner?  Iguana Cafe!   A friend recommended this place on our way home from a night out.  What a great suggestion.  I've been twice now.  This past time it was packed and the first time was empty so that's hit or miss.  The tables can be a bit small but what do you want with a coffee shop.   I had the spicy chicken pepper wrap (no mayo) and it was wonderful!  So tasty and the cheese was gooey from being grilled on a panini grill.  Delicious.  It came with potato salad or pasta salad.  The potato salad was not too creamy (i am not a mayo fan) and the potatoes were perfectly done.  The first time I was there I had one of their special crepes and it was amazing.  Some people made their own and others picked specialties and all of them were amazing.  They were packed so full of "toppings" and  fluffy and delicious.   So...  about $7 an entree...  Late nights...  what more can I say!  This place is great!

The staff here is so nice! I really enjoy the atmosphere and the coffee. Great place to go get some work done and relax. Being able to walk to it from my house is just a bonus. It def has a trendy feel with super affordable prices!

Cheap food under $10 with generous portions. Ambiance: European cool, trendy Food: Hummus and olive cheese spread was ok, not great. Prague crepe is delicious and very filling. Mediterranean style crepe with spinach, chicken, and feta was also yummy. Custard wrapped in phyllo dough is also very delicious!!! Decaf coffee is passable, and they charge for refills. Service: The restaurant wasn't very busy at the time. Service was very prompt, friendly. I will be back!

I am all against overusing of the term "European". European spas and cafes, restaurants and resorts... now give me a break. I am European, and I know European when I see one. Well, Iguana almost pulls it off. the ambiance is charming, the coffee is nice, the drinks are properly served. And the locale is to kill for. But I said "almost". the very essence of the notion "European" is an unserstated charisma, an elegant coziness. This place tries a bit too hard, a bit too much going for and not quite getting there. And when I recommend the place to my friends, and I do, the first quiestion is "Is it Ecuadorian?" Why? Try finding iguanas in Europe.

This is such an amazing place!  The interior is pretty classy, but the prices are so cheap!  Almost everything is under $10 (sweet crepes, savory crepes, sandwiches, wraps, and even pastas!), and their sandwiches are tasty and toasted.  I had one with prosciutto, tomato, and onion, and it was delicious, even if the prosciutto kept sliding out and trying to escape.  (I won every time though.  prosciutto-0 Jenny- 1)   Their crepes....Oh their crepes!!  I came here with my girls, so naturally we got the nutella crepe with chocolate ice cream and cookie pieces.  Oh yes.  You read that right.  Chocolate, chocolate, and oh yes, even more chocolate.  too much?  Is that even possible?  Nope.  It was just right.  And delicious.  So delicious. My friends are super considerate, always offering last bites to other people, but this was the FIRST time that I'd seen my friends stake their claim for the last pieces!  It was that good.  (chocolate crepe - 0 three girls - 1) FInaLLY, my girls and I are talkers.  We sit in one place and chat and catch up for hours, and this place not only didn't care, but they refilled our waters!  How many places will do that for you?
