All in all, great experience at Iguana Cafe, and I think each of our bills only came out to $11 with tip!  Can't beat that. (other places - 0 Iguana Cafe - 1)  Winner!! ps.  there's free street parking around the corner, just double check the signs.

Warm, soft and fluffy. This is not a pillow commercial. I was describing Iguana Cafe's crepes.  Generally, I am very skeptical about having crepes in America because it tends to be either too sweet or too salty. However, Iguana's crepe's seasoning is just right. Today I had a crepe with baked zucchini, sauteed spinach and mushroom. The zucchini's slight crunchiness contrasts well with the soft crepes. The dried tomato also complexes the flavor of the crepe. However, the spinach is overcooked and slightly too dry.  Although I do not live in this neighborhood, I would consider coming back. My friend and I like the fact that the tables are more spread out than most cafes, so we could have a long girls' talk. It also seems to be a nice place to study or work alone.  P.S. I came into the cafe with a Starbucks coffee, since I did not plan to come to a cafe for dinner. The host offered to exchange my cup with an Iguana's cup. Iguana's coffee lid is well sealed and would prevent me spilling coffee when I am in a hurry to work.  Food: 3 Decor: 4 Service: 4

Wow!  So my friend suggested this place to go to lunch and again wow!  The inside is small but very cute, comfy, and cozy.  It wasnt busy so we were able to get our cocktails and food pretty quick.  My girl had Venice crepe and I had the Zurich crepe....yummy!  Really good and very filling!  I cant wait to come back to this place...also very important (for me at least lol)....STEPS AWAY FROM GRAND STOP!.  No seriously its right there :)

This place is great... absolutely amazing. The food has never disappointed me and their prices are fabulous. The atmosphere is perfect for lunch with a friend because its peaceful and inviting, allowing you to chit chat away all you can.  My favorite lunch item is the grilled veggie wrap. I get it without the cheese (as I try to stay vegan 50% of the time) and it still has amazing flavor because of the fresh herbs and marinade. I am typically asking my server for all kinds of sauces for something like this but it doesn't need anything at all! The service is always friendly and drinks always cold.  I know its not in the most happening location but go... check it out! Its totally worth the trip!

This place is like a close, dependable friend. There for you whenever you need, ready to share a hot cup of coffee with you, or indulge in a sinfully delicious dessert with you without a side of judgement, and available for you all hours of the night.  i live just steps from here, and love this local hangout. It attracts an interesting crowd, one that is probably a good representation of the neighborhood, which I love. It's the perfect place to grab a cup of joe and catch up with a good friend or to have a quick bite to eat with the hubby.  Tables are small, but they put a few together to accommodate bigger groups. Service is pretty good and selection of coffee and other beverages is large.  Food is also super tasty, with the one exception being the time I had a crab dish and it was imitation crab. It should have been stated as such on the menu if they insist on serving that here. I haven't had their crepes or sandwiches but they look mighty delicious.  Overall, great spot, glad to have it in the neighborhood. The ambiance here really pushes it over the top for me. It has a great vibe and their Iguana Mocha Frappucino is delicious!

Solid 4 stars, but missing that extra spark to get 5. Read some reviews about slow, inattentive service which put me off trying this place for a while.  But it's walking distance so curiosity and convenience finally got the best of me. The good news is that the slow service must be an evening thing.  We went in for lunch and even though it was crowded, we didn't have to wait, and the waitress and the busboys were very friendly and attentive.   We tried a number of items (salad, appetizers, etc.), but crepes are clearly what people come here for, and after trying the rest I'd suggest sticking with the crepes.  Be prepared for some serious volume.  Even though Iguana bills itself as a European style cafe, I can't ever recall getting venti-sized portions like this in any of my European voyages.   The savory crepes come with a tomato slice as your only side.  It's not terrible, but it makes the plate look somehow unbalanced and incomplete.  Some potatoes or greens might be a better side for turning a crepe into a full savory meal. That said, the crepes (both savory and sweet) were delicious, and we'll definitely be coming back when the crepe bug bites us!
What a great find.  Solid food-had the carbonara, and a great place for a biz lunch in the city.  If this was closer to me, I'd be there all the time.

Pros: -In my hood -Prague Crepe was delicious!  all of my favorite ingredients mixed in crepe form(bacon, gouda, green pepper, mushrooms, and tomatos!) -Friendly service, a little on the slow side, but didnt bother me since it was an off peak time of day and the servers attitude was pleasant. -I can come here anytime after 3pm and still get breakfast, hey Im a night owl and sometimes like my first meal at 3:30! Cons: -No free refills on coffee, stating that due to the high quality gourmet coffee they charge full cup price on refills.  Ok, but there are plenty of establishments that offer better coffee with refills.   -Only has Tabasco for hot sauce choices.. I think I need to start being one of those weirdos who carries their own condiments with me because it blows my mind how many places just offer Tabasco...maybe the worst hot sauce in my opinion, watery, not that spicy, too much vinegar..ok this is a whole separate review in it's own and Ill stop now!   Over all, the food was awesome and Ill be back sometime soon..

By far my favorite brunch place in Chicago. Not too crowded, no long lines, reasonable prices, and able to create your own panini's/crepes (mine being hummus, jalepeno, hard boiled egg, and Gouda). :)

A cool little joint, perfect for a late lunch. Sit by the window and watch the hipsters preen and pose as they gavotte down Halsted. I had an excellent salad with smoked salmon. It came with these delicious pressed (in a panini machine) toasted sesame bread thingies. My wife--a vegetarian--got a veg. panini sandwich that she loved. All of this for about $16, so a fairly cheap lunch.

Mmmm I like me some crepes :) I've had only all things crepe here. For dinner I've tried the: Toledo - Mortadella, omelet patty, provolone cheese, green peppers, tomatoes & zucchini... The bf had the: Sparta - Chicken, feta cheese, sauteed spinach, tomatoes & sauteed mushrooms. I did enjoy my toledo but I feel like the insides were not hot enough. The crepe was delicious but the insides lacked some ooomf. My bf's crepe was pretty darn good (ey the neighbor's plate always seems tastier hehe ) On a different night we came here just for desert and had the: Tempting Trio - Nutella, banana & strawberries... Now this was to diiiie for. The nutella wasnt over powering, and they for sure put a lot in.. but they also put a lot of fruit inside. I must say the dessert is the best part of this restaurant, the 2 dinner crepes I've had weren't as good as I would have imagined, but I'll for sure come back to try other things. The place has a very cool atmosphere, very chill, and they have a real life iguana behind a glass!! Service has always been fast and the people working there are very nice. It always seems to be packed with people no matter how late at night, so call in and make a reservation just in case.

So finding dessert waffles in Chicago is somewhat challenging! I searched online and 20 mins later came across Iguana Cafe. Four of us went around 9:30pm on a Friday night, and the place was packed! A nice, smaller cafe/restaurant, dim ambiance - nicely decorated. We waited about 15 mins till we got seated.  Extensive menu with so many yummy items I would have loved to try, but we were there for dessert, specifically waffles! The server was a bit slow to take our order, i think we waited approx 20 mins till a server came to our table.  I ordered the Tropical Pleasures Waffles - Belgian waffle topped w/ a scoop of vanilla ice cream, fresh strawberries, banana, drizzled w/ chocolate syrup. My husband ordered the Bougatsa w/ Ice Cream. Both desserts were absolutely divine and heavenly!  Its nice to find a late night cafe in the Chicago area that has great food, great ambiance, and a great place to hang out with friends. Will definitely be back to try their regular crepes and dessert crepes! Lots of variety and selections, especially for our vegetarian friends out there.

This place wins in all categories for me: great ambiance, great food, great drinks, open late. Drank margaritas here (because I missed my chance on Cinco de Mayo) and had the baked goat cheese app. Good margaritas- stick with the traditional, the strawberry was too sweet. Goat cheese, large and delicious. Definitely for sharing.  Built my own crepe of chicken, hummus, mushrooms and feta. It was so damn good. The taste of the crepe itself was really excellent too. Plus those crepes are huge! Neither I or my dinner companion finished ours. And it's not just because we're girls.  Oh and the prices are great, which worked for us because we're poor.  I'll for sure go back to Iguana.

Been here a couple of times with my wife.  We are definitely fans of the Iguana.  The interior has a stacked stone appearance by the bar, and with the right lighting it kind of sets the mood to relax and enjoy yourself.  I'm sure we'll be back soon.

I always get anything here in crepe form, and their tomato basil is amazing! However, the service can be very slow. My guest and I waited 20 min for our check.  And, to use wifi it's $5.95 for 3 hours...yeah.

Five of us came here on a Sunday afternoon around 1:30pm and the wait was approximately 20 minutes. There are benches for those waiting to be seated and a small water fountain to entertain you for the time being.  When we were finally seated, we were welcomed with five chairs and two mini tables combined. It wasn't too shabby. We were promptly given menus and glasses of water. It wasn't long before we proceeded to ordering: cheesy crab dip, Napolitan pasta, three orders of crepe, two orders of waffles, and one bagel sandwich.  The cheesy crab dip are a must-order. It was rich with ingredients and were perfectly complimented with the toasted pita bread. The Napolitan pasta was also memorable. I love my pastas baked but it was too filling to finish it in one round so we took the leftovers to go.  The crepes were average and I do not recommend the chocolate monkey. It was all sorts of sweetness and the chocolate came spilling out creating a huge mess. I love my sweets but I think this topped it by a few notches. It also came with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, but it melted before I even got a good look at it. The waffles were ginormous and the vanilla ice cream scoop stayed intact even though we didn't dig in until some 15 minutes later.  We shared eight plates and it came to approximately $10-15 per person. Most of our dishes were $6-$9 each. Prices are very reasonable and the menu is very expansive.  The service, on the other hand, can be slow at times. I guess that was one of the major European highlights of the cafe. So when you do pay a visit, be sure to sit back and relax because you might be bound to spend over an hour and a half.
by far my favorite place in chicago! have been coming here for teh last 11 years and never left disappointed,! thank you!
Delicious.  Had a baked omelet and it was the best I've had.  It takes a little bit extra time, but enjoyed the European vibe and coffee while I waited.

I live few blocks from cafe and I go there quite often. I always get their caramel machiato. I love their smoked salmon salad. Atmosphere is lovely, I don't really care if service is not always perfect. I go there to experience food and atmosphere, not how fast my cofee is served...their menu is amazingly huge, so it should take care of most picky eaters...i definitely recommend this place.

2 reviews in one day? Live reviewing? Ladies and gents, it takes experiential atrocity of a certain level to compel me to do something so far out of my norm. Congrats, Iguana. You win.* As you walk in there's a sign that says you can't sit until seated. Cool. Nothing weird here. So, I stand, make eye contact with three employees... and keep standing. I stand, in fact, for 7 MINUTES before I'm addressed or seated. As I'm being led to my seat, I asked if this was the norm. The response I got: "I can't do nothing about that." That's stellar customer service, folks. Perhaps my miscue helped future patrons because after I was sat, people either sat themselves or were immediately greeted. Or, maybe I'm just special. Or, maybe, I wasn't seated because, as the bald-headed gent told me, "I thought you were here with those other guys." "Those other guys" were a group of African-American gents who were having a conversation up front by the bar. I never spoke to them. I didn't stand by them. Our similarities: being alive, being human, being male, being African-American. Apparently, this is connection enough. Apparently. The last straw: a waitress who came in, coughing into her hand and looking sickly. She walks to the back, comes back up front, laughs, hugs, coughs... and picks up a plate to serve to a patron. Done. Done. I'm done. Iguana's done. Everyone's done. Had enough. And you, dear reader, shouldn't have any. Don't come here. *Or, lose.

This place is great if you want to hang out and have a sandwich or a quick drink.  The crepes and deserts are great here.  So, it's a nice place to take a date if you're dating.  Also, I've always liked the staff that worked here.  Very nice and friendly staff that usually gets to you in a timely manner.  Crepes: Chocolate Monkey, Sandwich: Mediteranean.   Plus, the Iguana is kinda cool to see.  The next time I go there, I have to ask them what the Iguana's name is....

What can i say this is my favorite place, LOVE LOVE the food and atmosphere. When ever i get those moods and crave everything on the kitchen but the sink! Iguana delivers the best great hummus, crapes, waffles, wraps etc etc gosh im getting hungry. I guess its time to go back :)
You have to get their peanut butter nutella crepe.  Crepes should not taste this good. You will not want to share.  Get it a la mode.

this is my favorite place. up for a sweet or savory is the place to go. crab a cold beer or enjoy a class of wine and just talk. it is always welcoming and relaxing place. i can say i've had almost everything on the menu lol. have been going there for over 3years now. prices are not bad, food is great, service is good too. they let u take ur time no matter how busy they are. it's not like the other places where they rush u because there is a line out the door to get it. hummus is awesome. the savory crepes are the best. sandwiches as well. and the desserts!!!! desserts are to die for :) keep the good work up guys
one of my favorite cafés! Great atmosphere, great staff, and great food!

This will be our new alternative to Artopolis. Very cozy inside with a myriad of dessert/coffee selections, this would be a great place to have a first date. My only complaint is that it was quite warm inside (when I saw the thermostat on the way to the restroom, it was set at 77 degrees). Maybe to keep the iguana happy?

Very cute place and reasonable prices. The atmosphere is perfect for a chilled night out and staying low key. The only downfall is the location. I don't drive so it was quite a hassel to get there with connecting train and then bus. Nonetheless, lovely cute place!
Yummy food, cute little cafe in the city. Prices is good for the quaility of food. Everything is yummy, and service is good. Come here any chance I can ;)

I really like this place - nice mellow vibe.  Good place in the morning to sit with a coffee (which, by the way, is an outstanding brew) and contemplate life.  Quiet, but not too quiet.  i met a friend here for breakfast recently and its perfect for that type of conversations.  not rushed, or hurried.  The breakfast menu is limited, breakfast sandwiches, croissants, and waffles.  But given the setting and the superior coffee i don't need alot in the food department.

Came here for the first time ever, place looked decent enough but the experience was bad overall.  My friend ordered a salad and I had ordered their "house specialty" homemade spinach cheese pie as well as a dessert crepe, which I told the waitress the two of us would not be sharing after she had asked.  The spinach pie was a soggy mess that had to have been microwaved, crust not even close to being crispy.  I managed to finish it, and after waiting a bit as my friend was still eating, I expected my crepe to come and it never did.  A while went by and my friend was obviously finished with her meal, and another staff member came by and asked if we needed anything else to which we said we wanted the check, assuming the server had forgotten about my crepes which was fine with me at that point.  I stepped away from the table but the waitress delivered the check and said that the crepe was on its way.  When I came back I mentioned to her that I no longer wanted the crepe as I had been waiting for it and it was never brought to me so I didn't want to wait anymore.  The waitress then questioned me on that, saying she couldn't have brought out the dessert because my friend was still eating her salad, even though it had been made clear to her before that my friend was not sharing the crepe, and we had clearly been sitting there for a while after finishing our food.  I wanted to ask her if she always serves the dessert after she gives the customer the check.  In any case, the food was nothing special (definitely not a house specialty, and if it is then that is a poor representation) and the service was also unimpressive.  Will not be returning, Julius Meinl is still my go to cafe for crepes.

I've been coming here for several years and certainly have no reason to not keep coming back! The menu has a very wide selection of sandwiches, salads, appetizers and crepes. There is a full bar to get your drink on. Did I mention there is an iguana that looks above the dining area? My usual selections are the Amsterdam crepe (gouda, red pepper, sun dried tomato) and the combo spead (usually choose the Tirokafteri and Spinach Artichoke).  One can definitely feel satisfied for $15 here, and for me that usually includes a glass of wine (usually Tortoise Creek red). Service can be slow and a bit curt, but the waitstaff is mostly European, so that is to be expected. The people watching is always fun as the clientele is very diverse. I am a regular!

The service was bad. The waitress kept ignoring me and my friend and it wasn't even busy. She kept going to all the other tables but not ours.  However, the crepes were to die for. I had the chocolate delight and it was AMAZING!! I really liked the atmosphere of this place. I will go back.

Minus one star bc sometimes the service forgets you are here after they deliver your food. However, there are always busboys filling your water, and it's a small enough place to flag your waiter/waitress down. You can even pay at the register. That being said, it's Euro style in that no one rushes you out so you can stay and talk. The crepes here are AMAZING, whether dinner or dessert. Everything is fresh. The wraps are also really delicious, and most dishes come with a side of pasta or potato salad, which are both excellent. Any crepe with nutella in it is a must try. Also, the crepes are HUGE! Plenty to split with a friend or two (depending on how big of an eater you are) This is one of my favorite places to meet up with friends. The art is always changing, and it's clean and cozy. I should also mention that any friend I have brought here immediately adds this to their list of places, and makes sure we come back, and tells me that they have brought their own friends/dates/family who all love it. They also have a big TV, so it's a low key place to watch the game. Street parking. (There is a lot that can be used during the day, so you don't have to pay for meter parking.) Say hi to the live iguana! (his tank overlooks the restaurant, it's built into the wall, so he's nowhere near the food, just in case you were worried)

I love this place.  They have my fave juice - fresh grapefruit juice.  I've had the savory crepes twice.  LOVE THEM!  They are huge so I always bring home the other half for my boyfriend.  The sauce on the side is delicious.  It's very inexpensive.  Fresh ingredients and healthy items.  I will definitely go back.

The food and service are consistently excellent. Like the atmosphere, easy parking, and they accept reservations. A place to eat and run, or relax for a while. Cozy.  Nice music.  Has a TV, but pretty unobtrusive (and only one). This is not 5 star restaurant in terms of upscale dining, but for what it is, a cafe+, it deserves 5 stars.

I love everything that I've tried here! All of the apps are delicious, the sandwiches are great and of course the crepes!!!! This is one of my fav spots to meet friends for a low key night out. Highly recommend!

Best points of this place is that it's open late, great food, and good coffee drinks.  They have great appetizers, but this place is known for its crepes- I'm just not a huge fan of crepes in general and yet I still give this place 5 stars for the other great food they have.  I also love their freddo coffee here too.  Great place to hang out late or do a quick business meeting.

My favorite place for a quick cup of coffee, a breakfast sandwich or even dinner. Service is fast, and they let you linger as long as you want without bothering you. The breakfast sandwiches are amazing, as is the baked cheese appetizer, the latte's and the brownie and ice cream dessert. Ironically, the only thing I don't like here at all are the crepes. They're too thick and don't have enough filling. Other then that though, everything is great.

Great place although the location isn't wonderful.  The food is excellent although I haven't yet had everything on the menu.  The bar selection is fantastic as well.  I love the intimate setting but the tables as others have mentioned aren't exactly comfortable.  The background music was perfect for the meal and helped facilitate some conversation as well.  I would say go! There is really no reason not to.

At first blush, I loved the ambience and intimate interior. Everything after that was, unfortunately, a disappointment.  I went for breakfast and found the menu to be seriously lacking in options, mostly diner-esque variations of white bread and American cheese, which seemed off the mark for an establishment touting itself as a European style coffeehouse. Food arrived extremely bland, dry, and otherwise unimpressive. The coffee, which was billed on the menu as being of such a high quality that they couldn't offer free refills, was utterly mediocre.  The service was good and the prices reasonable, but the quality of the food didn't inspire me to go back and try the crepes I've heard so much about. For a greasy spoon diner, I would have given this place four stars, but as a proper coffeehouse and cafe, it fell short.

At first I was taken aback by the clientele. I felt like I should've been wearing a slouchy hat, rustic cowboy boots with ripped tights under purple shorts and a T-shirt with the name of an underground 90s rock band.... but alas, that party of too for school hipsters left and I was able to enjoy the laid back but sleek ambiance. Friendly staff. Fast and good quality food and service. I ordered a chicken pesto sandwich. It was juicy goodness. And for dessert- a bananers strawberry n nutella crepe. The crepe could've had more strawberries in them, but being winter with berry prices on the rise, I forgave them. But other than that I was perfectly done, not over cooked and chewy like some creperies. I can't wait to go back and try a few other dishes and deserts.

Do NOT come here for their savory crepes! I came back home to Chicago after spending 3 months in Paris, and I was really craving a savory crepe, so I decided to hit up this joint with a friend.  Now, I know it's impossible to find crepes that taste as good as the ones I tried in France, but the one I had here last Thursday did not even remotely taste like a crepe -- it was more like a huge pita (the crepe part itself was wayy wayyy wayyy too thick).  I'm not much of a food snob to begin with and I've had my fair share of mediocre tasting crepes, but this one was just plain bad.  It even came with this tub of mustard/mayo on the side.  The crepe itself was so bad that you pretty much needed to put the sauce on it to make it palatable (good crepes do NOT need extra sauces on the side -- that's technically the point since crepes are street food in Paris!). I had such a bad experience, I didn't even stay behind to order dessert.  I don't know, maybe you'll have better luck with their sweet crepes -- just stay away from their terrible "savory" ones.

The crepes here are so yummy.  I always come here for the dessert crepes.  Every combination i have tried is delicious.  I have had the food here too; it is really good, but i can probably make the same stuff at home.

On my travels through Chicago's cafes, it is rare that I find a coffeehouse with the Great Three: 1. Good music; 2. Good food; 3. Booze.  OK, perhaps the booze isn't necessary (and surely it shouldn't be, considering I'm supposed to be working! ...Mimosas never hurt a thesis, right?), but this place truly is fabulous. Clientele range from new mothers to graduate students, aging couples and first dates, and it seems as though we're all quite comfortable. The ambiance is top notch-- I'm a sucker for fireplaces and holiday decorations-- and when it's not the holiday season, the high-beam ceilings and palm trees create a very relaxing atmosphere. Plus, it's an atmosphere you can enjoy late into the night with such closing hours. The only reason I can't give Iguana Cafe is the fact that the internet is not free. I didn't think they did that anywhere but airports nowadays-- and only the really annoying airports that frequently delay flights and don't offer beer. $8 for 24 hours, or $6 for three and .10 per minute after.  But don't let that keep you from Iguana Cafe. The well-priced and totally delicious food should make up for it. Try the goat cheese dip; I keep asking for more pita pieces, just to get the last few bits! I'd be annoyed by me at this point, but that's another plus-- fantastic servers equipped with patience and friendliness for a gal six hours into her workday!  And yes, the crepes ARE that good. (Nutella, cookies, and ice cream-- now there's the true Great Three.)
Excellent place to finish the night. I always get their irish coffee, and they have a decent beer list for a cafe. My friends always love getting their crepes as well.

I was under a great deal of duress on my recent IC visit and I can attest that their Soy Chai Latte made me feel slightly less cursed than I usually do.  You see, I am the world's most unlucky person. Tonight my iPhone was stolen by the bitchy guy wearing more eyeliner than I do (quite the feat) behind me at a Florence and the Machine concert who asked me to sit down bc I was blocking he and his lady friend's view. I refused... as I paid more than the ticket price and if I want to stand and show my support for arguably one of the most talented voices to make it to mainstream today, by George, I'm going to do just that. And if you're not willing to stand for an artist that's one thing (you being lame), but personally, I'll be damned if I'm feeling a jam and I'm not going to get up, stand up+stand for my right.  So Bitchy Man had a problem with this and somewhere along the lines stole my iPhone from my back pocket. F to the M to the L. Keep in mind this is also the same week I got not one, but 2 flat tires 6 days apart and 2 speeding tickets within the last month, one of which was for going 2 miles over the speed limit.  Why does it always rain on me?  Anyway, the Chai here came up fast as f*ck. Like, I swear I had ordered the damn thing *maybe* 35 seconds before it arrived. And it was tasty as a mother... and by 'mother,' I defo mean 'mutha' (that's the good kind). Two things occurred to me after my first sip:  1.) I'll certainly be back for the crepes. 2.) I'm kind of a Mutha (the bad kind) for passing by here for so long and never giving it a chance.  Unlucky in life I may forever be. But a passerby of Iguana Cafe no longer, I am.

This place gets an extra star for the amazing Port wine from Portugal. The atmosphere is great here and more than makes up for the average crepes. I must have gotten lucky, judging by some other reviews, but my service was quick and friendly (European friendly, not American friendly, which I prefer anyways). The artichoke&spinach dip was one of the best ones I've ever had - barely any cheese, just the veggies! The Almond Joy crepe, was meh - I've had better. But again, the wine made everything better.

This is the only place in Chicago where I imagine that I'm Fernando Pessoa, sitting across the table from a glass of wine as my only companion for a session of introspection.  I like this place? Is that a question or a statement? I'm not entirely sure... it's not exactly memorable, but on the other hand it's exceptionally inoffensive. Good food offered at reasonable prices in a laid back environment makes me a fan. This is where I end up sometimes when I try to walk home from work and get distracted by how much easier it is to just sit at a table and have someone else do the hunting and gathering. Presumably Iguana follows a European tradition of hybrid restaurant/coffeeshop/bar/art gallery settings, and this spot seems to draw a rambling mix of dates, mellow girls' night outs, convening writers, and lone wolves romancing their laptops. The place is too dark to be a café but it's not too dark to read; it's too laid back to be a restaurant but the food's pretty good. I can't for the life of me recall the true breadth of the sprawling menu here, because I'm consistently drawn to their unique and interesting selection of crepes combining ingredients like sautéed mushrooms, spinach, various pigs and cheeses under identities like Prague, Budapest, Lisbon. The beer list spans the "worst of" international exports- Heineken, Becks, Stella Artois, Corona, etc... those foreign lands can keep their damn second rate beers. With half a dozen white wines and another half dozen red wines, I tend to settle on the tasty Reisling. The only thing I don't really like about this place is the music, which is probably a reflection on modern Euro pop and electronic trends. I hate that. "Try not to be such a hater, Rob R." I tell myself. "Shut up! It's just my opinion," I respond. This is the perfect place to bring together people who have nothing in common, such as the old married couple bickering inside your head.
I was here on a first date with my boyfriend.  It was an overall great experience.  Not too busy, very chill, clean, and from what I remember the service was adequate.

Very cool vibe. I met my friends there for coffee and wine last night (it's a perfect spot for both), and we stayed for hours. The desserts were great - I liked the bougatsa (custard wrapped in filo dough) and the lemon sorbet.

The food is good here as are the drinks. The crepes are delish and the coconut sorbet is amazing.  It's great cause it's open late. The service is great and the folks are friendly. I've been here a few times, and I'm a fan.  My one and only complaint is that they don't have free refills on the fountain drinks. Seriously? It costs them nothing, unless they're filling from 2 liter bottles, which they aren't.

Such a cute little cafe in West Town to meet friends or to sit and study.  You can pay to use their internet for a limited amount of time, and watch the live iguana lay under its heat lamp.  Their food is cheap, good, and with a lot of variety.  They have both sweet and savory crepes, and yummy salads and sandwiches.  Wide variety of coffee drinks. Most entrees are around $7, not bad!

This place has great prices on all of their food and drink options. This is not a place you would go to explore culinary treats, but it satisfies the hunger at any time, especially since it is open late. Great place to meet up with a friend.
This is my late night spot when we both don't feel like drinking but want to go out. We like their crepes and their milk with honey beverage.
Insider information will tell you that this place reeks of european cafe. It's one of chicago's best kept secrets. Good food, pleasant attentive service, and great atmosphere for a reasonable price
Ahhh....finally a place that serves yummy soy latte with ALMOND syrup!  Great place all year round.

UM....YUM!  Crepes and a whole lotta em.. Need I really say more? Ok, I will.  The scene is ok, kind of trendy, but that's the area. People are really nice. It's a very relaxed feel.  I've had the spinach pie, and a few of their savory crepes. All very very good. Very good quality ingredients.
great place to get waffles between breaks of heavy drinking

This place is dope... Huge portions about 2 people to one order. i only had the crepes which were so good. i didnt like the description on the menu so i added what i wanted and they were glad to make it.

Went here on a Wednesday for lunch...not at all crowded at 12:30 which was great...street parking was super easy too. We started off with an app...the spinach and artichoke dip was really amazing...a different flavor..very fresh tasting without the over the top cheesy flavor. I made my own crepe to replicate some type of greek crepe which was outstanding..my friend also raved about her pesto chicken pasta and my other two friends had their own crepes and sandwiches made to order as well and were impressed.  the portions are REALLY BIG!   We then progressed to be gluttonous and have the peanut butter and nutella crepe with coffee..which was very rich yet very good.  We split it between 4 of us and still had some left to spare.. after 4 people had an appetizer, one specialty drink, and an entree each and a split dessert, our tab was only 20 per person which is OUTSTANDING...why not the 5 stars...well service is pretty slow...we were really one of 4 tables there, and we were served pretty slowly..good thing we weren't in a rush..will be back for more crepes soon!

Passed by this place many, many, many times, and finally stopped by here today with some friends after lunch at Greek town. I've always thought this is a "coffee shop"...boy, was I wrong! They have a full range of cafe & "real restaurant" food, along with some pretty nifty drinks & dessert options. Since we just ate lunch, we just settled with some coffee, ice cream, and root beer floats, but I can see us coming back here to try out more food from their menu in the near future. The only thing we really didn't like about this place is that they charge to use the wifi. I can somewhat understand why they do it, but really...who charges to use wifi anymore? Don't be like Starbucks.

Cute cute cute cute cute! Very reasonably priced bottles of wine. Lots of vegetarian options.  Had the greek sandwich for $6.50 - great deal!  Usually in cafes I expect stingy little sandwiches - not the case here. It was large and in charge, totally delicious.  Some of my friends ordered the crepes and they were huge and also really reasonably priced. Service was excellent. I wish I had more excuses to come here! :o)

This place is the best. For late night canoodling, it's the best. For day long study sessions, it's the best (they have a full bar!). For a quick lunch, it's the best. For sometimes surly/sometimes sweet, always gorgeous Eastern Euro servers?  It's the best. God, I wish you could still smoke in here.

I was very unimpressed with this place. On their website they advertise themselves as a European style coffeehouse where one is welcome, whether they want to dine or just have coffee (and, in fact, refer to themselves as a "coffeehouse"  on their sign which usually indicates a more leisurely atmosphere). However, when I went there, the waitress was extremely rude as soon as she found out that my husband and I only wanted espresso beverages. First, she gave the disgruntled "is that it?" response then snidely, taking the menus away, said "well, I guess you won't be needing these." We drank our coffee as quickly as possible, though we had to expend a great amount of effort to get her to come by our table for the check, and what little she said was with a rather snide tone. It was very clear that we weren't welcome there. We weren't dressed inappropriately, nor was it crowded (only about 1/3 of the tables were taken) so I can only assume the attitude was based on the fact that we, encouraged by their website, had chosen this place to have coffee rather than dinner.  Additionally, the atmosphere seemed more like a European hotel restaurant than a European coffeehouse. While I've never been to Greece (where the owner is from) I have been to Rome, Naples, Berlin, Munich, Heidelberg, Copenhagen, Helsinki, Paris and London. The cafe didn't resemble any of the cafes I visited there. There was a big screen television, for one thing. For another thing, my cappuccino tasted more like something one would expect from a corporate coffee joint like Starbucks than the Illy and Lavazza fare one typically finds in Europe.  I just moved into the neighborhood, and frequently go out, not just for coffee but for lunch and dinner. I'm a bit of creature of habit, so once I find a place I like, I tend to stick with it. However, despite the fact that they had a lot of food I might have ordered at some other time, I won't be going back.

I did love Iguana! Because the open late in my neighborhood, because of the food and good moments i had there with my friends. BUT GUYS, YOU WON'T KEEP CUSTOMERS MAKING SANDWICHES WITH A TWO DAY OLD BREAD! i'm sorry, but you did disappoint me today with my favorite salmon sandwich. I just had to throw the bread away.

This review is long over due. I moved into this neighborhood about a year ago and without fail almost every week my friends and I hang out here. Whether it's to grab brunch, coffee, drinks, dinner or dessert. Cafe Iguana never fails with it's food, service and ambience. The menu is ecclectic so there is something for everyone. Their pina coladas rival those I've had at any tropical destination. And their crepes are so fresh and yummy. Lately, with the heat I've been stopping by for ice cream, and their dulce de leche rocks. This place has a great vibe, an interesting crowd and is laid-back.

Oh is this place a little gem!! I went here on a Monday around 12:45PM for a late lunch.  The place was kind of standing alone, not too much by it so I almost missed it.  Parking was very easy to find right out front, but bring lots of quarters for those damn meters! The spinach appetizer dip was average to good, the radioactive green color turned me off slightly.  My veggie crepe was excellent (just big enough to be satisfying without being too much )and their prices are VERY fair!  :) .  My dessert crepe was Nutella/ peanut butter and it was OH SO GOOD. A tad on the overly sweet side but hey what do you expect when you combine those two?  I LOVE crepes and good, light ones like these (not rubbery!) are hard to find. I am SO GLAD I discovered this wonderful spot!  Waitress was very kind and attentive too!  Normal crowd when I was there ( I'm not too big on "hipsters")
Even better than I remember!

My good review is based mostly on the coffee drinks. The food is just okay and the service is usually pretty slow. The chai lattes are quite good, but a little sweet. They have some great iced coffee drinks too. It's a nice little place to sit for dessert and coffee with big windows that open up to street. Cute place!

I like it here. Pretty easy street parking. It's open late. Coffees are strong and desserts are yummy. I have yet to try their real food, but I'm sure I will one of these days. Love how you can just sit there for hours and no pressure to leave and they checked on us a few times which was cool. They also serve coffee with liquor.......have yet to try, but maybe one of these days!

Great place to meet a friend or a small group gathering!  I've been here a couple times, and love going back.  The hours are awesome, I dig the vibe, and there's always something new too get.   The coffee and tea are excellent and the service has been always quick.  I always like getting the Mediterranean feast, or sandwiches!  It's a good place to share dishes too since portions great.  A friend and I once brought a birthday cake here, and they were kind enough to slice it up and bring us plates. I thought that was cool.

very cool place to hangout, eat, and meet new people! LOVE their liqueur coffee drinks, and deserts, sandwiches, and almost every thing. Even though the name is IGUANA, I feel bad for that poor Iguana placed on top corner on the wall. he looks lonely!
Super reasonable prices and some of the best espresso around. I go out of my way for the iced americano here. Really good bagel sandwiches as well. Great place to start the day.

I like this cafe even better than Artopolis I think. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but the inside is very cozy. They also have great music there. They have a wide variety of crepes, their sweet crepes are some of the best I've had in Chicago. Their strawberry lemonade is excellent. I have never had a complaint about anything there. Their coffees are always good, especially their freddos. It is too bad that it's not located in a cool area, it's a hassle to find parking and I don't especially like taking the blue line because it makes me transfer twice from where I live. But if I'm in the area, or if I really want to go there, I won't miss the opportunity!

I've been here several times and every single time I've been pleased. It's pretty solid spot for a nice brunch, light dinner, or even just for coffee and crepes, which are AMAZING I might add! The atmosphere is very dim, casual, and relaxing. It's usually fairly quiet and I love it during the summer when all of the windows are open. I've come here a time or two as a lunch break from work, but it's kind of pushing the time limit. This place is more meant for just a relaxing Sunday afternoon.

Decent food, decent service all in an odd location (with terrible parking possibilities but good CTA access).  The one thing that threw us off was being charged full-price for refills on coffee - that just seemed a bit nickle-and-diming for a cafe and certainly not in line with similar restaurants (I could have stomached a $.25 charge or something similar, but seriously, full-price?)

This place is amazing. Excellent Service, some of the best I've seen.  They take your order right away and come around at just the right time to see if you need anything else. They were even mindful of the fact that I was waiting on a few people and had a table set up for me when the rest of my party showed.  Great work guys!!
Food is consistently delicious. Ambiance inviting. I mean, what else?  By law they can't tickle your Bon-bones.

Stopped here for breakfast after returning from India.  This was my first visit, but the bacon egg and cheese croissant hit the spot.  They grill them so they have the marks on them and it was truly delicious.  The coffee was just ok, but I drank 3 cups.  I will return here to try more items and admire the wonderful art on the walls.

i have been to iguana café an incalculable number of times.  if you could devise a complex analytical function which takes into account the no-pressure atmosphere, quality of food and drink, hours of service, incredibly nice and genuine staff, and the general need for cafés like this in the city... you would find that the point representing iguana cafe would be approaching the positive limit of that function. free wi-fi would be a lovely addition.

Amazing little place that reminds me of the coffee shops I loved in college. They cut some corners, which some people might not like.  Cold-cuts for meat, desserts are shipped in, they don't do much with sauces, and I've learned to stay away from 2/3rds of their menu.  But I haven't found a better place that serves food until midnight on weekdays and 1:30ish(?) on weekends.   My favorites: the spinach-artichoke dip, the pizza bread, any of the pastas (huge portions, $8-9 each only), and their dessert crepes.  This place has saved me countless times after night classes when I haven't eaten all day and in 15 minutes I can get a quality, filling meal for $9.

This place is great.  If I could give it a 4.5, I would, but I'll have to settle for a 4, just because I think 5 deserves perfection.  I often come here for coffee (my favourite thing being the Mocha Iguana Special) and to study.  Great atmosphere in the spring and summer months as they have big doors that open and allow the breeze to come through.  The desserts are great, especially the Bougatsa and the European Dream Waffle which has chocolate, caramel, ice cream, and nutella all on a belgium waffle... oh so good.  My girlfriend and I come here often to split that. I just signed up for yelp so that I could start reviewing some of my favourite places in Chicago and this is the first place that came to mind, so rest assured, it's good.
Forget about all the other places I've loved in the past...this is my new love....

It is my firm belief that a coffeehouse should serve as a more or less unobtrusive environment within which a memorable period of conversation or contemplation is able to enjoyably pass. This is not to say that it should be totally lacking in character...or characters. There is a certain bohemian flavor I enjoy in the best coffeehouses...especially those billing themselves as 'European' in style or attitude. The Iguana Cafe was a little low on the earthiness scale for my taste. Otherwise, the dessert crepes and dessert waffles at the Iguana were good. The coffee was fine. The prices seemed more than reasonable...the most expensive bottle of wine was around $24. The customers there seemed to be having a good time. For locals, it's probably the kind of place that becomes the place to go.

This is hands down the best creperie in Chicago.  It is a great place to hang out and enjoy a coffee and a tasty snack.  The prices are very reasonable.  You get table service for coffee shop prices.  There are a number of Mediterranean appetizers that are quite good: bruchetta, goat cheese dip, and olives and red peppers sampler.  They have many sandwich options (I would recommend Italian sandwich and the meatloaf sandwich) and a few decent breakfast wraps.  It is a good place to also watch sports.  The wi-fi internet is not free and the place is not that quiet, so it is not conducive to doing work.  I have seen people come to do group work, but mostly to hang out and have a conversation.  The decor is quite pleasant, they have a number of cool paintings by a local artist and they change as they get sold.

I have essentially been living in the West Loop for about 5-6 years now, and have always wanted to go to Iguana, but never seemed to make it in. A friend of mine wanted to meet for a drink and a snack, and so suggested this little mediterrainian cafe that I had been driving by for years without visiting.  I'm not going to say that the service is absolutely perfect, but if you have ever been abroad, you will understand why you can't always find your waitress... they expect you to sit, take your time, enjoy. Go in with that expectation, and you will thouroughly enjoy their good wine selection,  wonderful coffee, & excellent food (must recommend the grilled croissant with nutella! not on the menu, not complicated, but O.M.G.)

A great place in a weird location... glad I finally found it.  Really cheap menu -- most lunch sandwiches, pasta, etc. under $7.  Loved the hummus and this spicy feta spread that I couldn't pronounce. Service was pretty slow - but remember it's a coffee shop.

This is a very cute/cozy little place. The crepes are huge, so if you're looking for a small dessert, don't count on it. They have Sweet and savory crepes, so you don't have to come just for dessert. The specialty coffees are really good. They come out in huge mugs which I adore! I had the nutella and banana crepe. So good. Staff was very nice and accommodating. Parking can be a bit of a pain but it's totally worth it.

It's a coffee shop with food, super late hours, and wi-fi.  A perfect equation for an awesome place right?  Not so much with this place.  Here's a few things they need to work on: - Their coffee.  It's gross.   - The food.  It's worse. - The service.  Each time I've been, our waitress has been close to non-existent.  This is the norm for a coffee shop, but you occasionally do need someone to show up. Once, a friend ordered a specialty coffee drink and got a regular coffee.  She asked if she could trade her drink for the one she ordered.  The waitress seriously brought out a shot glass with a flavor shot. - The wi-fi.  It's $10/hr.  It's 2011.  Why does this place not have free wi-fi?

The staff is kinda snobby, but if you speak some kind of european language that is a different story.  Chicago accents don't impress, I guess! But....it is open late! Yea! The ambiance is cool, the vibe is relaxed and casual, but it is very "Urbane Chick".  I love the artwork and actually bought 2 paintings from local Chicago artist, Misa. I  LOVE them! The Greek salad is:  GREAT!  plus, the prices are, too. *P. S.  I never order the crepes (diet) but, every-time I see a person eat them, their eyes pop out of their heads.  I think this might be a good place for crepes--but, don't quote me on that!

This is my favorite spot in the entire city. Iguana is the ideal place to chill out and relax. Everything I have eaten or drank here is fantastic. Their crepes in particular are super tasty. Nice staff and a cozy environment.

Definitely one of my favorite places in the city.  Great food, consistent service, and extremely reasonable prices.  Great to go for a glass of wine or coffee with friend, and great for a slightly more casual lunch or dinner.  I love designing my own dinner crepe - reminds me of my days in Amsterdam!  Their signature iced tea is also out of this world!

Wonderful atmosphere and excellent menu.  This is a great place to hang out for hours or just to grab a bite.  Excellent coffee drinks and the bar looked great too. All of the menu items are fantastic at this European Style Cafe.  Highly recommended.

Conversations over a warm drink at a cafe is on the top of  my list of ways to spend a cold wintry night.  It's my second time here.  I honestly forgot what the entire first experience was like but I want to point out how yday I discovered the  BEST....oh wait for it....flavored steamed milk :) in town.  Creamy savory desert in a generous cup or bowl may i say.  The item is listed as steamed milk with honey but if you ask for other flavors, you will find they serve it in hazelnut, caramel, almond and mocha.  I got the almond; friend had the hazelnut.  I've gone all around town looking for a nice spot that serves it so understand why I will write an entire review on steamed milk haha...needless to say, I slept very well that night I think I might frequent this spot in lieu of nights out in town more...I closed the night with a glass of shiraz, which was mediocre..if I donned my fatty pants, I wouldve gone for a desert crepe... BUT despite praise for their milk...there was an incident that was.... another friend was planning to join us and when he arrived, he was scouting the area for our table.  the hostess/host decides that he must be with the one big group of asians in the far corner of the back area....ironically there was another table tucked in the mid section of the spacious cafe, where WE were actually sitting. one thing i have to say is plz don't assume.  We werent' necessarily offended. We got a good laugh out of it but I told my friend I will yelp this so here's for his cause.   i know how everyone loved my rant on steamed milk but there are other highlights on the cafe - we spent over 3 hours there and did not feel rushed at all for seating - location is close to a six way intersection, parking doesn't seem like an issue -decor and artwork give a warm ambience (i love brick walls) -good for conversations, not too loud -most non-alke drinks were under $3
Great place. Good quality food and very reasonable. One of my wife's top 3 eateries in Chicago

All breadth, some depth. An Austrian coffeehouse by day, with laptops and wifi and casual lunch diners, the Café becomes loungy by night - a low key bar/legit dinner-dessert parlor.  Want a tea or a coffee or a wine or a beer with your crepe or sandwich or sundae or pasta or soup? All of it will be good, especially the dessert. Check the nutella offerings. Veggie selections are a bit rare, vegan pretty much absent.  Come in at 7 a.m. for brunch, noon for wifi, 11 p.m. for cocktails. For weaker places, this would be an identity crisis, but this iguana is a chameleon (groan).

I ordered a soup here and immediately went to the bathroom to throw up. But it's probably not 100% Iguana Cafe's fault since I was hammered the night before. Service was friendly, but not fast. I believe there's a REAL iguana in the glass tank in the corner. Pretty cool. I'll probably come here for late dinner, but if you want breakfast, I'd rather go to Orange near by. This place is good place to read a book or study, according to my girlfriend. Street parking is easy, but I hate how expensive the meters are nowadays.
I love this place for lunch and crepes! The food is great and cheap! try the Pesto Chicken Sandwich is GOOD! friendly environment and good coffee!

Before I begin, I want to make it clear that I was only here to try dessert and/or a drink. We had ate dinner nearby and walked a few blocks on a cold Chicago night out to Iguana, having heard that it was a great place for dessert. My friends ended up sharing a couple of dessert waffles, which looked amazingly good but since I was so stuffed from dinner, I did not try them. I wanted a smoothie and a smoothie I got. Even though one of my homies told me that the smoothies taste more like icees here, I still wanted to get my fix. It was definitely better than an icee, but not really as good as a traditional smoothie or a home made one either. Service was great. It was quite busy on a Friday night ~10pm, so we had to wait a little, but once we got served it was quick. Nice little place that I will need to check out once I am in Chitown again!

I've only been once thusfar, so I can't give it 5 stars just yet, but I LOVED what I saw. I ordered myself a hot chai latte with a nutella-caramel crepe, and was blown away by the service; They even put a scoop of vanilla ice cream in my latte like I asked! (It sounds weird, but trust me, its delicious) The crepe has the perfect amount of nutella and caramel in it, and the latte was delicious. My friend who was with me ordered a decaf mint mocha latte, as well, and she loved it. The waitress was very friendly and quick with getting our drinks to the table, and best of all, everything was delicious. The best part about this place, I think, is that it's open relatively late during the week; 12:30 on weekdays and til 2 on Fridays and Saturdays. I want to go back and see how their bar and their food are, so until then, 4 stars, for sure.
The crepes were ok (I had the Amsterdam). I really liked the banana and strawberry with sugar crepe and the ambience. A relaxed place that is not expensive so it is a good value for money option.

Looking for a nice, sit down cafe after hours? - This is the place! The ambiance great - warm, inviting, eclectic. I had the Chicken Pesto Pasta, it was amazing. My friend had the Napolitan Baked Pasta and didn't like it as much, but loved mine. The service was friendly, but very slow. I had an empty glass of water for the duration of my meal. Other than that, this place is nice and relaxing - we sat there for over 2 hours and weren't disturbed!

Ok, so it's after 9pm and we are hungry.  Where should we go??  Well we literally stumble across Iquana Cafe and enjoy a nice snack but swear we are going to come back for breakfast.  My friend and I come back the very next week for breakfast. Iguana Cafe did not disappoint.  The food was yummy.  If you order their baked omelet just keep in mind it will take about 20-25  minutes.  Let me tell you it is well worth it.   The atmosphere is cozy and great for breakfast alone or with company.  They have free wi-fi and seem open to you spending the morning there.  The only things that really bothered me were that there were 3-4 employees and only one server.   I could not quite figure out why the server was running around and the other employees were just standing around.  Seemed a bit disorganized to me.   The other thing that I totally missed was that coffee was not free.  If you purchase 2 cups the 3rd is free.   That being said the coffee is Yummmmyyy and I drank my 3rd cup.  Overall, Iguana Cafe was really good.  Great atmosphere and they actually have an Iguana IN their cafe.

What I love most about Iguana?   It's ALWAYS exactly what you expected.  The food is excellent, the drink selection is 2nd to none, the ambiance is mello/funky/coffeshop/lounge with tame lighting that's neither "romantic" nor "deli" and music that is hard not to like!  The seating is broken up into 2 sections, which makes it feel more cozy - less cafeteria.  The thorough dessert selection is sure to meet everyone's needs & an HD tv is conveniently set to "Mute" so that you can follow the news at any moment without it ever interrupting your thought process.   2 things I would change if this were going to be the new location for Heaven?  More power outlets (for those of us on our laptops) and Green Tea Lattes (the matcha kind).  Free wireless would be nice...but I'm guessing that might change the clientele, so maybe not :) Some people do feel the need to bring kids here - it's not the worst thing in the world, but this is definitely an adult establishment.  The people bringing their kids here are the ones who are freaking out that they're parents and are trying to prove to themselves that they're still "young".  It's ok, go ahead and grow up, we don't mind :)
Huge portions of sweet crepes. I got the nutella, banana, and honey...awesome...worth splitting, unless you have a healthy appetite. will come back again to try some more!

My girlfriend and I stumbled upon this place by accident during a girls night...the ambiance was great and we were seated right away.  The menu has a European twist and the coffee is great. I was disappointed you have to purchase 2 cups of coffee and then the 3rd refill is free....haven't seen that spin before. The weight staff was nice, however a bit disorganized. There appeared to only be one waitress for the food area while several others monitored the front bakery area....which left us waiting longer than preferred. We did go back for Brunch and noticed an improvement so it could have been just an off night.  The food is AMAZING ....definitely going back!

Ambiance: 10/10 Service: 9/10 Food: 9/10 Veggie friendly: 10/10 I ordered cafe au lait, pesto cream pasta and a mud.... ice cream cake  - everything super good :)  the cake of ice cream was very very hard so just enjoyed the ice cream part which was excellent. My friend ordered a chicken caeser wrap and was raving about the taste.

All of their food is outstanding! I eat here at least once a week. People often tell me they see that place but haven't been, and when we go they love it! It's really affordable, great ambiance and friendly staff.

I love this place, since I got back from living in Europe I haven't found better crepes.  I love the atmosphere and the food. they have great artwork hanging around and always have jazzy trendy music I can't find on my own. Its a great place to take a nube when you want to look kewl and have them say, "man, you know places like this."   Great chai latte, and my favorite sandwich there is The Greek Sandwich. It won't disappoint.  great for vegetarians, makes you not miss meat.   The crepes are delicious, try the tempting trio (bananas, strawberry, and nutella). The service is pretty good too. Even the bus boys feel like servers, like they actually care for what they are doing.

They are not good to their customers. We used to eat here several times a week during lunch at work but now we have boycotted. Whatever you do, don't order another diet coke because they charge you for a whole other drink! Absolutely ridiculous. They have lost our business.

Awesome place, open late, good cheap prices, good drinks and food. Got the chai coffee and the crab dip appetizer.  I got the nutella crepe and added almonds, strawberries and a bunch of other goodies and it was still under $7.  The waitress was nice and fast.   There is a real life iguana up top in the wall!!

This cafe is perfect. Quiet--but not without stimulation, World Cup was playing on a silent flat screen, unobtrusive service, great salads and sandwiches... I have a stack of magazines that I've been dying to get caught up and was just wondering where I should do that. Then, poof! it hit me, walking home from downtown earlier today.  Great place for a bite most any hour. It's also a nice spot for a first date if you're looking for an alternative to the bar scene.

I've passed this place several times and never realized what I was missing. I'm going to go back for sure-- I really liked it. The size and ambience are perfect for a casual date or hanging out with friends. They have an extensive menu. Unfortunately, I came after a huge dinner so I couldn't sample much of the menu. We did share a dessert-- I can't recall the name but it had flakey dough on the outside and creme on the inside and served with ice cream. Quite delish.  They have an enormous menu filled with sweet and savory crepes, sandwiches and wraps, dessert, drinks, alcohol. There's something for everyone. And the prices for the food were reasonable.

Always  a win here.....the atmosphere is nice....everytime i have brought  friend (and one date) it was quite enjoyable.  Wait staff is always friendly..and there is a wide variety of clientele that walks through those doors.  And on the back wall is art that changes (and for sale) which impresses me in its originality. The food smells good; I have only had the red pepper hummus, but word on the streets is the crepes are fantastic.  I went last night with a fellow yelper and enjoyed myself.  One thing I was alittle suprised...the frappe wasnt that great last night....I let it slide for a one time thing as it was good the other times I had gone. The location is nice as the river isnt too far and if you are there on a weekend there are a couple of bars and clubs walking distance.  Tesas is right there too if you want a cigar.  I also notice bus and train  stops there....no parking to speak of as it is on a main street.

Iguana cafe serves tasty crepe and good coffee. I go to UIC so it's just a short trip from there. The atmosphere is what I like the most. It always feels cozy and comfy. Service is okay not outstanding but that is fine with me.

This is one of my favorite cafes.  It's a European-style cafe.  They have a pretty extensive drink and food menu for a cafe.  The crepes are delicious - try the tempting trio (bananas, strawberry, and nutella).  Don't forget to check out the live iguana they have in a glass case on the top corner of the room.

I give this place five stars because it's open late, the coffee comes in stemware, and the food is excellent. The folks who work here are very nice, and the atmosphere is energetic all the time. I've only come for the coffee and food, but what's cool about this place is that it's a cafe, restaurant, and bar - that's right, alcohol's also on the menu - all in one. I haven't been able to find another cafe in Chicago that's open as late as Iguana, and the good news is the coffee's tasty enough to enjoy even at midnight. The only downside is that the wireless isn't free, but that's more than made up for with the live iguana on display.

After an amazing dinner at La Scarola my friend and I wanted to have some tea. We went over to wind down and after seeing the dessert we had to have some. We shared the brownie sundae and my friend got green tea. Her green tea was disgusting, it tasted spoiled. We are both green tea drinkers and this was really rather disgusting. The waitress was not around much so my friend didn't get to have another tea because by the time the waitress did come we wanted to leave. When my friend told the waitress the tea was really bad and she didn't want it. The girl did not apologize, she was actually rather rude about it. Brownie was good though but the way the waitress was and just how horrible the tea was made me give it the rating that I am
Cute european servers, universally mediocre food and not terrific coffee. The ingredients are just lousy, but I guess you're paying for location. And refills. And wi-fi.

You have no idea how many times ordering lunch from Iguana Cafe saved me during the horribly boring four hour long Monday afternoon manager meetings we used to have at my old job. The only thing that made being there bearable was when our food from Iguana cafe would arrive. For the next hour I would slow sip my smoothie thinking intently about how good it was and pretending nothing else existed except for me and my lunch.  Excellent wraps, great milkshakes and smoothies that have the power to save your mind in the face of total boredom. What more could anyone ask for?

Three and a half stars for Iguana Cafe.  This place is a solid, coffee lounge.  Great stuff: - They are open pretty late, especially on the weekends - Pretty cozy place, with a nice european touch - Serve up booze - Variety of light-fare and sweet desserts As far as crepes go, I was a little unimpressed, especially because I got prematurely excited at the prospect of finding a european cafe that serves crepes in this neighborhood.

Did this place have free internet at one point, or did I imagine that?   At any rate, the no longer have free internet, and nothing nearby that you can ... um ... borrow.  Star down for that.   As other people have said, you don't exactly go expecting a stellar dining experience, but you do for the great ambiance, and a clientele that is different from your standard sbux crowd.  It's the perfect place if you're meeting up with a friend for a quick drink or snack.  Also, the crepes, coffee, and option for alcohol are all outstanding.   And let's face it, the fact that I can't get an internet connection probably means that I'm going to get more work done.  But I digress ....  Added bonus for the resident iguana.  I've only actually see her/him move once, but it's uber-cool anyway.

During my Funky Buddha Lounge days (2006-2007) I would hit this spot up sometimes before hitting my favorite dance/party spot. This Sunday I thought it would be a good idea to drop in. My girl had never been here so that gave me an incentive to take her to this "European cafe". We saw the cakes @ the front register so we automatically knew what we wanted. We both went with the Tiramisu, but I got a peppermint tea and she got a white mocha latte. The tiramisu was delicious and my peppermint tea was very soothing. I had a sip of her coffee and it was good as well. Prices here are pretty reasonable. I forgot how much I liked this place, but what I did not appreciate was the slow service. We waited awhile before anyone took our order...The people that came in before us had their order taken before us. By the time someone finally had shown up to take our order, someone else came shortly afterwards to take our order as well. Hopefully I caught them on an under staffed day or something because I would really love to start coming back on a regular basis.

As a coffeeshop, this place gets 4 stars, but as a restaurant, it gets 2. It's a nice place to grab a drink of your choice whether it be beer, wine, coffee or tea to catch up with a friend, but if you're going for the food, I'd suggest another place.  Well, Iguana might be up your alley if you like utterly mediocre food, or food that's even worse than mediocre. I had the chicken basil noodle dish. It came highly recommended by the waitress. The sauce was pretty good (even though it needed a little salt and pepper), but the chicken was awful. Dry, stringy and ick.  I didn't give up vegetarianism for crap food like this! Actually food like this makes me desire my days of vegetarianism. Just a thought. I'd go back, but just for the desserts and coffee! And the ambiance. I liked the wood painting - was it wood, or was it painted to look like wood? Or was it both??? Boggles the mind.

I just got back from "brunch" here.  It's in quotes because I barely ate.  I barely ate because St. Patrick's day was yesterday and you can figure out the rest.   The water was good. The coffee was better. My vitamin water was just alright.  It's called "revive" but that's some false advertising because I feel like I need another nap now. Apart from the various liquid hangover cures at my table, I did somehow finish a crepe without feeling more nauseous, so points for food (I also asked my friends how their food was for a better consensus to remove all biases and they agreed).  The servers were attentive, and the 3 guys wearing suits sitting on their computers drinking coffee weren't the least bit creepy.  Strong euro vibe, which works for me.  Don't know how to finish this review so I'm just going to go nap.  Bye!

I can come here everyday. This place is dubbed as "A European Coffeehouse Lounge". That is exactly what it is. Reminds me of the cofeehouses in Europe. Love the fact that you can come here for drinks but also can come for great coffees including Nescafe/Frappes,very common in coffeehouses in Europe. Their crepes are great especially the nutella w/bananas,the dessert crepes are HUGE so be prepared to eat it all or split it with someone. The wraps and sandwiches are great too. The ambiance is very cute and they play light house music in the background. There is an actual iguana in a glass case. Open pretty late which is a great alternative to bars/restaurants.

Iguana Cafe is a fun late night spot, especially after having dinner in the loop or hanging out at a couple of the bars or clubs around the corner.  I love that it's open late and that they serve a really great (intelligentsia) coffee and dessert menu.  The dessert sizes are HUGE so no worries in fighting over dessert even if you split with a friend.

I like this place,  the food is great (I love those gnutella crepes), the atmosphere is cool and the coffee is wonderful.  Also, its open way later than most Chicago coffeehouses.    Sadly it still lets down in a few areas. First of all, if your going to have a late night coffeehouse, give it some sofas to make it more comfortable, I guess they are going more for the Yuppie venti latte crowd than the Bohemian coffeehouses that are far more common in other very large cities. Also, I had a bad experience in regards to their hours.  I'm used to a laid back approach to Coffeehouses, where if they are open late they generally let customers slowly make their way out of the store.  When I was there with a friend, they pretty much tried to kick us out 30 mins before closing time!  If you are going to make a chill late night hangout spot that isn't a bar, let people linger a bit and enjoy it as much as possible.  (I'm totally spoiled by the Highland back in Cincinnati, as far as Chicago coffeehouses go, this is one of the best).

I came here on Sunday night for a bite to eat, bottle of wine and plenty of time to sit and catch up with a dear friend. Iguana is the perfect place for this! Bottles of wine are priced incredibly fairly (all within $20 - $30, not bad in my book) and food is pretty decent too!  My friend ordered a glass of sparkling champagne and the smoked salmon sandwich.  I ordered a glass of merlot and the oven back chicken pesto pasta.  From the prices listed on the menu, I did not expect to get as much food as I did! After our meal, our waitress didn't try and hurry us out.  The people around us all had their computers and books open, and made it comfortable for my friend and I to sit and chat over our wine for a while.  Someone ordered a chocolate crepe as we were walking out the door which smelled... sooooo yummy... The next time I need a quiet place to study and get work done, I'm definitely going to come back to Iguana.  And with an appetite, as I plan to order the crepes next time! :)

I rolled out of this place full of delicious crepe goodness & strong caffeine buzz.  Portions here will blow your mind.  The nutella crepe I ordered was twice as big as my head & packed with sweet hazelnutty perfection!  Size does matter!   Wonderful spot to just chill.  Whether you're a college kid studying for finals or just need a place to kill time doing a crossword puzzle this space fits the bill. Come here instead of Starbucks/Barnes & Noble/Borders for: *big tasty desserts *huge heaping cups of whatever caffeine beverage makes your heart palpitate (seriously, their drinks are strong!!) *full bar *great people watching *great late night dessert option *unique European feel *ample meter parking on Halsted

Ohmygosh, I LOVE this place. If I lived down here I would be here all the time. It's not really a convenient place to drive to or a nice place to walk to, but it's right off the Blue Line and it's sooo sweet. Walk in and it looks like a dark, swanky wine bar or some fancy boutique European pastry shop. Lots of space for you and a friend to sit and enjoy your meal, good and cheap coffee, great prices for quality food and a liquor license!! If you are single, this seems like a great place to meet people. If you  have business to meet on, it is a quiet murmur that you can speak over and work through as your personal office all day. If you want to gab with a friend and grab an alcoholic's coffee, this is your place. The more I think about it, the more I love the atmosphere. This is what the Cheesecake Factory at the Hancock Building was trying to go for: relaxed but sophisticated. For the two hours I was here, the wait staff was really friendly and attentive but definitely left me alone to do my thing. They didn't even care that all I ordered was a coffee. I wish this place would open up another location up north. I would be there every day.

For the sake of keeping things simple and sweet, five reasons (one for each star) why Iguana Cafe is an absolute gem: 1) Because when the dessert menu at the place you had dinner is less than impressive, Iguana Cafe has the goods (in the form of tasty cakes and delicious crepes) that'll satisfy your sweet tooth.  No more trips to Cheesecake Factory and Grand Lux Cafe at 10:30 PM (not that there's anything wrong with that). 2) Because Iguana Cafe has a liquor license and can make your coffee boozy.  Coffee is good; boozy coffee is better. 3) Because the service is attentive without being annoying.  Plus the servers use these cool PDA's to take your orders.  The PDA's are the size of bricks and it's debatable if they actually help speed up service or not.  Doesn't matter -- still cool in my book. 4) Because portions are ridiculously generous considering the prices.  Seriously -- order up a crepe (make sure it's filled with Nutella at a minimum), consume said crepe and prepare to experience that glorious satisfaction that only comes from stuffing your face silly with something both ginormous and delicious. 5) Because they have a real live iguana chilling on their premises! (Ok, it's technically behind a glass window.  Still chilling though.)

The food is high quality, prices are reasonable - arguably inexpensive, and upon entering the cafe, you feel as if you've stepped out of Chicago and into mainland Europe.  It's one of the most authentically European cafes in the city  (see also La Creperie), complete with snotty euro-attituded waitstaff.   Snotty eruo-attituded waitstaff?!    Eah, don't take it personally.  This is Chicago, we do things a little differently - let me explain. It's a very Midwestern thing to have a happy-go-lucky, cheerful, and gregarious wait staff.  Only in Chicago and Milwaukee (empirically speaking) is NICE expected of a waiter/ress.  Europe & the UK (empirically - London, Oxford, Paris, Prague, Athens, Madrid, and Barcelona. Exception: Ireland) does not regard "warm and fuzzy" as a necessity in waiters/resses.  In the US, we have evidence of this too - talk to most anyone who's just returned from a NY, trip.  Did s/he compain about the service?  Unless s/he had wads of money to spend at 5 star joints, I bet restaurant-service complaints were had. In Chicago we like things a little soft and a little warm.  But, we also like fairness and quality.  At Iguana, you get fair prices and high quality.  Enjoy the atmosphere.  Don't take it personally if the waiter/ress has a bit of a 'tude.  Treat it like a anthropological experience.  You'll enjoy yourself.  I promise.

Had a lovely time here after an awful experience at Bottom Lounge. The chocolate monkey crepes are grin inducing. I brought half of it home for my boyfriend because the portion size was INSANE! I will definitely be heading back here for other meals, but I kind of feel like it's now my go to place for sating my late night sweet tooth.

You know those places you pass by for years, then once you go you knock your head and say "I coulda hadda V8!"? Yeah, Iguana Cafe was on my bike route about  8 years ago and I would pass it by every weekday, thinking, "when I have time I'll stop in". The space is amazing- not at all what I pictured it to be from the outside and with "Cafe" in their name! The high ceilings and warm wood touches decorated for the Holidays made Iguana a nice place to meet over lunch. Their salads and sandwiches all looked great, but I was feeling the need to bulk up for winter with the Meatloaf sandwich with roasted red peppers and melted mozarella. The sandwiches are panini-pressed and warm. The meatloaf was nice and savory and there was enough to take home! The side of potato salad was almost as good as my mom's, kudos! The price for sandwich and side was only $6.50. There is pay Wi-Fi, but this place would be a great place to stretch out and get some job-searching or homework done during the day! There is a real live iguana in an aquarium. I didn't see the iguana, but Iguana Cafe could be seeing more of me!

We came here for a quick dinner after some wedding dress shopping for my friend Grace's upcoming nuptuals, and I liked it just as much as I did the first time around.  They have great desserts and such, but we stuck to the salads (did I mention wedding dress shopping? exactly..) and it was delicious!
